Reviews.Title: “WHY YOU SHOULD NOT SPEND A NIGHT AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: HAMIDY918
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at this unusual hotel in Venice, Italy. Be careful with the "Superior Rooms" They are located in a separate building what they call a castle. When they take you to this remote building, you have yo make a sharp climb 40 stairs up with all your luggage and of course no help. You actually go up into an apartment which has 4 rooms and you occupy one. If you object and dont accept the room, they leave you no option and force you to accept since you have already given them your credit card information you actually have no choice. They further explain that the superior room is what i selected and actually was the only thing available. For the breakfast do not expect more than a coffee , tea and a pastry.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Samantha S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located (though not the easiest to find if you're not familiar with Venice) and clean. It also seemed safe. Unfortunately, although we had specifically requested a non-Smoking room, the room we were assigned reeked of smoke. When we went back downstairs to inquire about changing rooms the rather surly guy at the front desk basically accused us of lying. I understand that there were no rooms available to move us, but he could at least have apologized and treated us politely. They also started cleaning the room next to ours around 8:45, and because the walls are thin we were woken up. Other than that I had no complaints. The room was simple but perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “short family break in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Anne S
Reviews.Content: We have just recently returned from a short trip to Venice - what a lovely destination. We very much enjoyed our stay at Hotel Benardi. Our room was in the annexe a very easy walk from the main hotel. Our son was delighted that there was wifi access in our bedroom. Transfer from Marco Polo Airport on Alalaguna was easy but slightly expensive although a fantastic way to arrive, we decided to use the airport bus back (included on our 72 hour Vaporetta ticket giving us unlimited access to the routes along the Grand Canal and out to the islands). Bought this ticket afternoon of our second day so transfer back to airport was included. Only main thing for the Hotel to improve on was the instructions given by the breakfast staff, on our first morning we weren't sure what we needed to do and the staff didn't give us much help, but by day 2 we were "up to speed" and knew to ask for whatever drink we wanted (including a lovely hot chocolate for our son.) We would choose to stay here again. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Cost hard to beat in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Firesuite
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a 4 night break in Venice, and were very happy with the location, plus the rooms were spotless and furnished with very pretty old style furniture. We are well aware that it is very difficult to find accommodation at such a reasonable price in Venice, and chose this hotel based mainly around cost. However, we did find the shower very cramped and we had intended to take advantage of being away to sleep late in the mornings, but found it quite hard to do so due to the noise from the hotel corridors and surrounding rooms (we were on the top floor of the main hotel building).

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tessie O
Reviews.Content: 3 girls Saturday evening arrival from EMA returned from Treviso @ 9.30pm Tuesday. Travel- Ryanair, efficient, bad landing but bought return bus ticket to city centre for 13 euro, well worth it as bus is outside airport ready and waiting( double decker you cannot miss it). Bus takes about 40 minutes but if you don't go with Ryanair there are ticket offices in airport before you exit with similar offers, AVTO about an hour Brazi buses about 45 mins. Arrival to Piazzalle Roma - buses take you here which is in effect the end of main canal. Get off the bus and look for the red zebra crossing ( if you check the busstop when you get off the return times are on there, every 3o mins till about 8pm). Cross over and you will see the boats and a ticket office. The main line is Line 1 which goes to all stops on main canal through to Lido, tickets cost 6.50 euro and last one is about 11.20 pm. We got off at Ca D'ora, 5 stops, at 11.30pm and all very safe and clean. Boats - the main canal is serviced by waterbuses (vaporetti) that have yellow bustops along the canal, easy to spot. Tickets can be bought on the boat but you must tell them as you get on that you do not have one. You cannot buy returns on the boat but ti kets last one hour on any boat so you can hop on and off at most stations there are ticket booths, when you have a ticket you scan it before you get on WARNING they canfine you 50 odd euro if you do not. These are regular, cheaper than water taxis and fun to see all areas. You can get passes, we were there April 2012 and it was 16 euro for 12 hrs, 18 for 24 hrs etc. Hotel - we stayed in a shared room at Hotel Bernardi Ca D'oro, basic but clean with shared bathroom in corridor. We never saw anyone else using the bathroom so felt private, if you want a place to lay your head this is it, our room had view of the alley but was very clean and room service came every day, it cost us 60 euro per person for 3 nights in shared room and was well worth it. There is a curfew here for 1 pm, almost everywhere shuts at midnight and boats stop running before this so not really a big deal and on one night when we wanted to stay out later they accommodated us as we gave prior warning. This location was great, we were practically in the middle of the island and financially it worked well, 5 min from McDonalds and the only supermarket we saw and also a few minutes from The Irish Bar, again only one i saw and drinks were really cheap when compared to other places. I did get bitten by mosquitos at the hotel so take a plug in, we did not have breakfast here although it is available for 5 euros. The reception staff were lovely, helpful and worked out our broken Italian! There is a TV with two English news channels, beds have sheets and blankets with comfy pillows, the room had a sink with complimentary soap, plastic cups and shower gel. The only thing that would have been great would be the addition of some more mirrors as 4 girls and one mirror was a struggle and we could not find a full lentgh mirror in the hallways ( room 20). The hotel was very quiet which was wonderful, you can hear the church bells ring but you are in Italy and it adds to the experience. Drink - find a supermarket! Water is 30 cents but outside of the supermarket 1.30-1.60 euros, there are no real newsagents so you have to pop into a cafe. Coffee - you can get a latte for 1.50 if you stand at the bar, sit at a table and you go to minimum of four euro. Wine - 3 euro standing at bar 8 euro sitting down. Beer - in a restaurant i was asked did i want a medium or large beer, i said large and it cost me 12 euro! A medium was a pint and this was 6.50. ASK for a drinks menu before ordering as they offer the food one and ask do you want a drink while you are waiting so they make a lot on this. FOOD - there are many cafe bars and for breakfast we chose these but prices vary greatly, we had a coffee and a panini and for three of us one day it cost 20 euro and the ne xt 30 for the same items in a different place. Lunch was often a pizza slice or another sandwich and came in at around 4 to 5 euro. Dinner we chose set menus which are available everywhere although look around as some do not charge on top for service or seating and other do. A typical 13 euro menu was a boel of pasta and sauce and then a prok chop or piece of fish with a side ( chips or salad - they called chips fried potatoes on the menu ). This is e only side on a set menu, you do not get any other garnish. For 18 euro you also get ice cream but drinks are not included. Trips - guide are extortion and nothing you cannot do by yourself but do take a MAP, there are thousands of tiny side alleys to get lost down but they are all signposted really well and major attrqctions are signposted in yellow all over the city on the sides of buildings so you will not get lost. Riallto Bridge - lots of shops and markets around here, more graffitti than expected. San Marco Square - shop around, my friend got a Murano glass clock here for 4 euro which we saw in other places for 20 so it is not always the most expensive place. The BASILICA is stunning and on Sunday morning the prayers are on speaker across the courtyard. It is free to go through the main entrance but we could nt enter the church with mass on. Campinale - in the centre is the. Big tower, 8 euro to go up in the lift which is worth it for the views and pics but ut is freezing and super windy. When you are outside the Basilica and Campinale you can see two columns, one with a lion and one with a man. Left of the lion is the promenade, great views, pics and shopping. Right take you to San Marco waterbus and Harrys Bar ( famous for the bellini byt also 10 euro for a coke!) if you get the waterbus frm San Marco you can go to Murano. Murano - we got the waterbus 6.50, get there before 12 and one of the factories let you see the glass blowing for free, 3 minute presentation so we saw, bought some souvenirs and jumped back on the waterbus in the hour so we did not have to pay another 6.50 back. The trip on the water takes about 15 minutes. Jewish Quarter - this was really interesting and every two hours there is a tour for 8 euro from the synagogue explaining why Jews were exiled here. There is also a shop called Davids Shop, this man is super helpful and you can pick up some allly great gifts and souvenirs as his sister makes Murano glass so necklaces and earrings start at 2 euro and in other places they are charging 8 plus. There is also a Kosher restaurant called Gam Gams which is nice. I am Catholic but meeting David made me feel very welcome and very interested in the culture, great place! Frari Church - small fee to enter, 3 i think, insanely large ornate church, very dominant and from outsid eyou would not expect the vast area or stunning interior, however the statues did scare me, look out for the white eyes on the four black statues near the pyramid tomb, terrifying! Peggy Guggenheim - we got the bus to Academia, the whole area is very arty but kn the way to the museum there is a little corner bar where drinks like coke and coffee are 2 euro, i think it is called the corner bar and is the only one he. 12 euro for the museum which was too much for me on the day so i made do with looking around the museum shop and browsing through the books, Venice Jazz Club - we went here from a recommendation on trip advisor and it was soo good! Get the bus to Ca Rezzonico, walk down the alley and you reach a square, turn right and go over the bridge ( secind bridge here is the Bridge if Fists in the guidebook where men used to fight to the death). You will see a small vertical sign that says JAZZ in black and white. It is a hidden gem, 2 hour cncert led by Frederico the bar owner, coats 20 euro and your drink is included, small and intimate playing Myles Davis, Elliot Duke and Charles Mingus when we were there, also serve food between 8&9. Venice - there are no bikes, cars, scooters, skateboards, it is foot or boat so take trainers, most people are wearing them as it is like a workout especially with the number of bridges. It is expensive but street vendirs are serving top quality food and if you are tired grab you food and head to one of the many squares to sit in the sunshine. People have a lot of small dogs with them, including in the bars?! Treviso Airport - very small, do not go untik you have 2 hours until your flight as they will not let you into the gate lounge and there is hardly anywhere to sit. Before you check in there is a reasonably priced food lounge and a newsagents, however no English language books or mags. If you want food you had to lay first at the newsagents when i was there even thought there were tills in the food court. Do NOT listen to shop assistants when they tell you it is okay to take drinks through, 100 ml limit stands as they confiscated our Grappa! After check in there are four shops, duty free, sandwuches, coffee and clothes. Once you go through to your gate be oreoared again for no where to sit, about 20 seats for 4 gates? Souvenirs - prices vary massively, i paid 20 euro and saw the same mask for 10 and 40, the paier mache handmade masks start at around 100 euro but are beautiful, Murano glass ranges from jewllery to cross to lighrs, fishbowls and even the Scream sculpture, they make everything. Scarfs are also popular and you can get a ten euro scarf to six ir seven when bartering, there are few items you wint find somewhere else. Pasta and spices come in all shapes and sizes and some with free eye masks so you get two gifts for the price if one. Safety - even though alleys are narrow most are well lit at night, i felt very safe with friends and alone. I would imagine pickpockets could easily get close in summer as you are often pushed due to the narrow lanes and there are beggers, not many one every few miles but around Riallto Bridge they tend to follow you asking for money rather than others who are sitting on the streets displaying injuries. Mobility - i do not see how anyone with limited mobility could see the city, the streets are flat not cobbled but the amount of bridges and the sleek marble edge to the steps would be a concern for me. Anyway i had an amazing time, would do it all again exactly the same way with the addition of a couple of days to go to the beach at Lido and to travel to a few more of the surrounding islands!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Shisher
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay in the hotel but ventured in for help. Even though I wasn't a guest they took time to assist me in finding and contacting the agent of an apartment I had arranged to rent. I am impressed with their kindness and am sure that they would be even more gracious to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: pupsik
Reviews.Content: This was out last stop during our trip to Italy. After rather disspointing hotel in Florence, I was prepared for the worst. Agian location was great and top reason why we picked this particular hotel. The hotel it self was ok, rooms are small and bathroom is even smaller. Farely clean and of course old furniture that could use bit of updating. I guess they are going for shabby chick kind of look. Since you did not come to Venice to be in your room its by all means managble. We had private bathroom and it was small but good enough for quick shower. I am not sure girls about any leg shaving as I am under 5 feet and it was tight, lol. The bed was very hard, almost like park bench some people like it, I sure don't so I did not sleep well. We did not have any view as the hotel located in tiny street. Also be prepared to carry your luggage upstairs but it seems to be the norm in small hotels. We paif 65 Euro a night so I think its pretty good value for the money. They also offer basic breakfast. The only thing I did not care about was the attitude of front desk, which treated some guest rather with dissprespect, ok toward us but not outgoing and somewhat cold. There are 3 restaurants on the street and the one right accross is great, so make sure to have dinner there, that place is called Ai Promessi Sposi.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: trekkerbelle
Reviews.Content: good room size for 3 people and their baggage. Located in a quiet area, and close to transport stops. Several good cafes/restaurants nearby. I would stay here again and have recommended it to friends. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MJEM_22
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bernardi was awesome. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and chose a room in the annex. It was nice and private- we felt like we had our own apartment in Venice! We would LOVE to stay here again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a budget stay”
Reviews.Author: kat1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there 23 to 27 Dec for 4 nights. For the price I paid â‚¬118.- total for 4 nights, breakfast not included and shared shower - WC on the floor, it was an adequate stay. The cheapest I have ever paid in my about 20 times travel to Venice. Location central (Cannaregio, closer to Rialto). The room I had was on the ground floor, a real single room, a real single bed ( 90 cm I guess) small room so really for 1 person. These are no surprise and no complaint. It had a wash basin with water in the room. And it was shaped in L form and one area was quite dark which was not convenient. They could add one electric lamp there. No problem with hotel staff, can be a bit noisy (not much) in the morning due to ground floor location and with staff working. But if you are looking for a budget stay knowing all above conditions, you can try this place. I would come back if my next visit is also budget and the hotel offer such low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: jaso155019
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as one of the few places that had a quadruple room at reasonable price. We were pleasantly surprised by the room we had at the annex, a few blocks away. It was huge with a private bathroom and beautiful furniture hand painted furniture, murano glass chandeliers, and wood paneled floors. The windows overlooked a tiny street. We slept so well and late that we missed breakfast the next morning. Our daughters were so comfortable. Santini answered my numerous emails being a first time traveler with children to Europe. She recommended good places to eat. Two nights were far too short. They even kept our luggage after we checked out. I would go there again but this time with the room with the view of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alan D
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bernardi is a quaint, conveniently located hotel. The rooms are adequate in size, but not too small either. FYI, there is no elevator that we could find so we had to haul our big bags upstairs, but this wasn't a big deal really. The concierge gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants! We had a very nice stay overall, and since we were there in the off-season, the price was right as well.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place!”
Reviews.Author: Valentin R
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel, nice and quiet in the evenings, away from all the hustle and bustle but still walking distance from all major sights. Modrate priced restaurants nearby, also very close to Supermarket Billa. Leonardo and especially Santina extremely helfpful. Room small but more than adequate, great off season prices!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value base in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DMc5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September and had a great time. Considering the prices of other hotels in Venice this definitely was good value for money. The room was clean, though not the largest it was comfortable - How long would you spend in your room anyway when the amazing Venice is just outside? It was walking distance to everything and the most enjoyable day of my trip was the day we just wandered from St Marks back to the hotel. We even decided to walk back to the train station with our luggage when we were leaving as it was more comfortable than the overpacked water buses and only about a 20 minute walk. We had a shared bathroom and shower and I never had to wait for it. All I will say is that this place isn't for those who want the 5 star experience but it was definitely clean, comfortable, well located and I would be happy to stay here again if I returned.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Lovely in a great city”
Reviews.Author: mnr717
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in October 2011 and were pleasantly suprised with the room and friendliness - especially of Santina (I believe that was her name) anyway, she gave us great recommendations on places to eat & even tried to help us with a few Italian phrases - which we were not good at. Location is perfect, right in the middle of every everything. Only negative - and these are minor was the free breakfast was just not that great & our room had a odor, but that could be because everything is surrounded by water. Neither of these things took away from the wonderful time we had in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Would come to this hotel every time!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Bernadi in September 2011. We stayed in the annex which is a block away from the main hotel. We would highly recommend staying in the annex. The room was wonderful and newly renovated. The location is absolutely prefect - a very short walk to the Rialto bridge, and very close to the Vaparetto stop. Being in the annex makes one feel like you have your own apartment in Venice! The staff and reception were very helpful and friendly. There are also lots of wonderful restaurants close by. We loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: 5Bears2011
Reviews.Content: Accommodating a family of 5 in Venice on a weekend and while on a budget is a challenge but Hotel Bernardi fitted the bill well. The directions on the website made finding the Hotel easy and it is in a good location near the Ca D'Oro vapretto & traghetto stops. The Hotel is easy to find after only one visit which is a bonus in maze-like Venice. We were accommodated in the annexe which is a straightforward 2 minute walk from the main hotel. We had a faboulous, comfortable & spacious family room over-looking a wide street with an extra bed added for our 4 year old. The service was efficient without being friendly with the most disappointing aspect of the stay being the breakfast. While a step above the traditional Italian breakfast of coffee and a hard roll, the cordial-like orange "juice", poor quality instant coffee and packet pastries were second-rate compared to the tasty fare already experienced in Switzerland & Germany.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Haven in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jane829
Reviews.Content: I would like to highly recommend the hotel HOTEL BERNARDI-SEMENZATO in Venice. My friend and I were there to attend the 2011 Biennale, so we didn't need to spend any time in the hotel except for breakfast and bed. The room we had was clean and well-appointed, with sparkling shower and loo ensuite. Towels were changed every day. I would like to add a few words about Santina. She was the receptionist who we found very helpful and generous with advice and tips of where to eat, providing us with maps and short cuts. Santina even wrote a postcard for me to my son's Italian mother-in-law because I don't speak or write Italian, and I was so grateful. I will be returning to the art exhibition again in 2013 and will be staying in the same hotel. So thank you.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Deirdremacd
Reviews.Content: 4 friends shared a large room w/ private bath in the annex. room was beautiful, old fashioned, great detail,beautiful furniture, very comfortable. Staff was lovely, especially Santina, very helpful and knowledgeable. great location on Campo Santa apostoli, quiet local square but just minutes from the buzz of the Rialto. Lovely little restaurant/bar opposite the hotel, great food and proseco, cheap! Supermarket round the corner and several good restaurants close by, 3 minutes walk to Fundamente Novo and boats to the islands and the airport. Everything we could have wanted for our fabulous trip to Venice at a reasonable price, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: chacow
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great location, comfortable, affordable, and friendly service. We stayed one night in Hotel Bernardi before boarding the 14 days Mediterranean cruise for our honeymoon. We informed the hotel about our occasion and hoped we got some special treatment. It worked, they were so kind to give us a nice, huge room with a bottle of wine. I remembered this to my friends who are going to Venice in Nov, 2011 Charles Architect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaTravels907
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice at the end of our 2 week stay in Italy. Venice itself is very expensive, and my husband and I really didn't get what the hype is. I mean, besides the fact that the canals are AMAZING we didn't find much authenticity in Venice, plus we couldn't ever find anywhere to just sit down and enjoy the scenery (besides an expensive cafe) like we did in Florence and Rome. The "streets" in Venice are also really cool, its fun to wind around in them and get yourselves lost. But Venice is very touristy. Not to say that it's not worth the visit, I'm glad we went. On a good note, Hotel Bernardi was a good pick. The decor is old and a little worn but the hotel is clean and a very good budget accomodation. The location is perfect, in the middle of all the good stuff. Venice is small though and everything is close-by everything else. We didn't take the water taxi to the hotel, we just walked the main strip from the train station since all we had was carry-on suitcases. It was about a 15 minute walk. The "street" you have to walk down to get the the hotel is very narrow and can be easily missed, but there's a little sign that says the name of the hotel on it. We were lucky enough to be looking around lost and some nice man said, "Hotel Bernardi?" and pointed us in the right direction. I'd recommend the hotel to others who are looking to save some money. Breakfast was good enough and plentyful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan T
Reviews.Content: On the advice of many other reviews, we asked for a room in the annex building (http://www.locandaleo.it/). Our room was gorgeous! It seemed like more of a suite than a room. It featured high wood-beamed ceilings, a private bathroom, double sinks, parquet flooring, etc. The hotel is near the rialto area of venice, tucked onto a quiet side street. The only drawback to the annex building is that it does not have WiFi access. The main hotel has free WiFi in the lobby though. We did not see the staff very much since we were in a different building than the main hotel, but they did allow us to leave our luggage there while we waited for our room to be ready after we arrived in Venice in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Lamaree
Reviews.Content: I traveled w/my 2 nieces. We all loved the location - just a short walk from the Vaporetti stop. We were in the annex w/a lovely large room. The location made us feel like we were living like locals since we weren't in the midst of all the tourists, yet could be to central spots w/ a very short stroll. The staff was very helpful to us. Breakfast buffet was adequate. We would definitely stay here again & recommend to anyone looking for a great location at a great price in this very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelDFWTexas
Reviews.Content: Due to some unexpected circumstances, our one night stay turned into 11 nights, and I can only say great things about this hotel and it's staff. The owner was so helpful with finding me a room each night despite full bookings, gave great advice on best ways to get around Venice, things to see/do, etc. The rooms were nice and clean, location is fantastic, and the breakfast worked great for us. I can't say enough nice things about both the hotel and the owner. HIGHLY recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara K
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent three nights in Venice - which is possibly the prettiest city in the whole world - and loved the convenient distance to the main sights: Piazza San Marco, Rialto bridge, etc. Breakfast was simple, but good. Our room was lovely, had a really romantic atmosphere, and was still comfortable and functional. Wi-fi signal was excellent in our room, even though it was the last room of the last (third) floor. The downsides: we are aware that many buildings in Venice simply do not have room for an elevator, so we have no problem with climbing steps; still, we would expect the evening recepcionist to at least offer us some help with our luggage - in fact, we would expect him to at least stop talking at his phone whilst checking us in. Anyway, that did not spoil our stay, and won't keep us from coming back; and, to be fair, all the other members of the hotel staff were attentive and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable quality in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Butterflybry
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for the price we paid (family room on the 1st floor in the annex). About 35euros each for the 4 of us. The staff could speak decent english, and checking in/out went like clockwork. Breakfast was simple but an all-you-can-eat, so there's no chance to leave hungry. The room was nicely decorated for a warm homely feel. excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: jackjudi
Reviews.Content: We had 3 night Venice stay early Sept 2011 in the annex (2 mins walk from hotel) on first floor, one flight up the marble steps.The room was great with private bathroom (Room 6, I think). Beautiful traditional Italian decor. Location was very good, a 10-15 minute walk to San Marco or 5 minutes to Rialto bridge with plenty to see along the way. Highly recommend & great value for money. The restaurant just outside hotel lobby also great for coffee or a meal. At breakfast (incl in the room price), coffee was great but food just average.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: saxena84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for couple of nights and loved this place. We stayed in the annex which is 2 minute walk from the "main" hotel building. The annex is brand new from inside. Room was great, clean and not too small. Room had a TV, an AC and a wash basin. Bathroom was outside the room but was not shared. We loved the room. You'll have to climb two floors in the annex to reach the rooms, so if you are travelling with too much luggage, you may want to ask them for a room in the main building. Hotel location is great. Its a short walk from the water bus stop. If you are feeling adventurous, you may want to want from the ferrovia to the hotel, like we did. Hotel is less than 10 minute walk from the Rialto Bridge. Breakfast is basic but we had no complaints. We would stay in again on our next trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been a lot better”
Reviews.Author: JeffB1237
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, we were told we will be staying in the annex a few blocks away from the main hotel. The annex has 2 long flights of steep steps and with a 17 month old child it wasn't what we expected. Nor was it anywhere in the hotel description. The lady bringing us to our room explained to me that the steps are not a big deal. I explained with a young child we require an elevator, and she told us this is the room they have available for us. She explained carrying a suitcase up the steps was not a big deal. So I let her carry our heavy suitcase up the steps. You should have seen her face. I felt a little bad, but worse at the way my family was being treated. I was more concerned at the time with getting my daughter safely up the stairs. Then the air conditioning in the room didn't work. The same lady answered the phone when I called to advise her about the a/c. She said "don't worry, be happy", and then told me she loves living in Venice. I explained to her I am happy she loves living in Venice, I am happy to be visiting Venice, but I also expect a room with air conditioning as the hotel description states. We stayed in August and it was very hot. Nobody fixed the a/c and we were not offered a room change. So we slept with the windows open, it was very hot, and by the time we left the hotel after a 2 nights stay, our 17 month old daughter had about 7 mosquito bites on her legs and arms. Not good. She scratched them for about a week. The annex rooms are large and nice (if the a/c is working).. however, the bathroom had zero ventilation and we had to prop the bathroom door open with the garbage pail because the humidity inside was unbearable. So.. on the bright side.. We enjoyed our time in Venice..because of Venice. Not because of our hotel choice.. the location of the hotel is good and so is the price for Venice.. the breakfast was ok.. but as the title of my review says "could have been a lot better". The hotel made zero effort to correct my concerns. I repeat... zero..

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice gelateria and resteraunts nearby also water taxi rooms are decent breakfast is very minimal”
Reviews.Author: VPraj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a nice area off of the main street in Venice. It has a lot of "annexs" meaning the room we had was in another building, it was a large spacious victorian type room, but i wouldnt be surprised if te other rooms are completley different. It is very close to the ca'd'oro water taxi stop and is also only a 20 min walk from the main train station. There is a really nice gelateria called gelateria ca'd'oro and also a resteraunt called do forni that seemed packed with locals. Breakfast was minimalist and Id suggest skipping it for some local bakery or somethin. Italy is not the place to waste meals at.

Reviews.Title: “Best price in Venice!!!”
Reviews.Author: lagardenia
Reviews.Content: Good price, Rooms are big and breakfast is included. Excellent location, 10 minutes from Plaza San Marcos. Vaporetto is 5 minutes. I even got a bottle of Prosecco, their "spumante" wine.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm with modern amenities.”
Reviews.Author: matha1645
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Minutes from Rialto Bridge and easy walk to St. Mark's square. Wonderful restaurants and bars near by. The room was decorated in historical style with a modern bathroom. The room was extremely clean and the air conditioning worked perfectly. The room was bright with two large windows. The staff was great and courteous at check-in. Also, very helpful with directions and suggested itineraries. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Next time we'll try somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Rich C
Reviews.Content: The Good: the room was clean and we had a window that looked out into an alley over the front lobby door. The Not-so good: the bathroom was so small it was hard to use. We're not picky but the breakfast was poor. However if you don't mind factory packaged chocolate croissant and bulk cereal you'll be fine. Noise from the pub across the way. Just O.K. Next time we will try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Santina's the best”
Reviews.Author: yvonne c
Reviews.Content: Santina at the front desk was wonderfully kind and helpful. She went above and beyond to make our trip easier, and her English and French are both flawless. Thanks again for everything! And the hotel is on a quiet street off a lovely, bustling square, very close to the main road through the neighborhood. It's a wonderful base from which to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A good cost-effective”
Reviews.Author: dgmelo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 7 days at the Hotel Bernardi Semenzato. The location is very good (although a little far of the Biennial, if this is your intention to visit the city). Our room was very comfortable, bright, with a good bed and a nice bathroom (although the shower was weak). The air conditioning was nice and quiet. The breakfast variety was not large (as we were in Italy, we expected some cheeses and hams and only had cream cheese), but it is ok. The staff was very friendly. On the downside was the fact that the internet did not work in the room (only in the hotel lobby), contrary to what was promised. This was a problem, and when we warn about the bad functioning of the wi-fi, there was not a concern to solve the problem (a week is a reasonable time to solve this problem). As we travel with a computer for research on the city, that was a big nuisance. I recommend the Hotel Bernardi, but next time in Venice maybe we try another hotel with warranty for the wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good price”
Reviews.Author: LorenaMarques
Reviews.Content: Hotelsin Venice are very expensive. This one had a good value and were in a place that was great. Next to the vaporeto stop, Mac Donalds, Ponte Rialto, the stop to go to Murano and it was very easy to go anywere by foot. The included breakfast and the wi-fi from my room was good. My friends were in the anexo, 5 minutes from tha main part, the room were bigger, but they didnt have internet acced over there, only in the reception. That is only complaing we have. We didnt have small refrigerator in the room, but we were able to use the refrigerator from the hotel. I strong recommed to stay there if you want to enjoy Venice withou spending a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cheap and well located”
Reviews.Author: VoiliVoila
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Bernardi hotel. We had a room in the annexe. The room was quiet, nicely decorated with a Baldaquin bed and the air conditioning was powerful (essential in Venice in July). We had mentioned we were coming for a romantic weekend and got a bottle of spumante for free, which was a very nice attention. Breakfast is basic but up to the standars of that category of hotel. The location is very easy to reach from the train station and allows you to reach the major Venice spots by foot. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY PLACE TO STAY, - BE WARY IF YOU HAVE ALLERGIES”
Reviews.Author: BexfromOz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for three days - It was a beautiful quaint place to stay. It was a little hard to find, but so is anything in Venice. The staff were lovely, the breakfast was average, but its included so it isnâ€™t an additional cost so expectations werenâ€™t too high! The room is perfect place to rest a weary head after being lost in Venice all day! The only thing I need to note is that the room is cleaned with a very potent cleaner, which reacted with me so badly I thought I would end up in an Italian Hospital... No complaints but it was the only hotel we stayed in that I had such trouble, and I donâ€™t usually have any trouble, but as soon as I walked outside 5mins later I was fine... Just a word for the wise, it is a lovely place to stay and I would go again, just need to open the room up and air it out before actually sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: HollyP7
Reviews.Content: Venice is very expensive but Hotel Bernardi was a good value for its location. You paid for what you got - nice if a bit dated room and bathroom but very clean and obvious pride taken in keeping the hotel comfortable and welcoming. Map of Venice provided on arrival and was contacted by the hotel beforehand with directions and any specific room requests.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful People, But A Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Teenfoodie
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel and waited for a while for someone to check us in. No one was at the desk. After about 10 minutes, a nonchalant woman walked in, and did not apologize for keeping us waiting. Instead, she led us to an annex a few minutes from the hotel. This was rather annoying at first (we had no advance notice) but the room was basic and nice. The person who led us to the annex had been dreadfully cold, and we hoped others would be kinder. This was not the case. That night, we went to inform the person at the desk that we were checking out early the next morning, and would like to pay now (we only stayed one night). The hotel had specifically asked guests who left early in the morning to pay in advance. But the man at the desk looked at us as though we were stupid and said "Then why not check out tomorrow?" and then abruptly left to do something else. We came back the next morning and it was the same guy. He was very unfriendly, and looked as though he was sick or had a headache. We left in a bad mood because of the rude service. Nonetheless, the price was very good for Venice, and the room was not bad. Still, the service affected our impression of the place immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Location and affordability.”
Reviews.Author: whi3916
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel and its annex building are a couple alleyways back from the noisy thoroughfares and so enjoy a quieter atmosphere. The map on their internet site is worth downloading to get directions to find it. Its only a few vaparetto (canal ferry) stops from St Lucia railstation and a 5 minute walk in from the main canal. St Marks square and the Rialto Bridge are the main landmarks in Venice and the hotel is within 20 minutes of either (walking or vaparetto). The closer you are to either of these landmarks the more expensive the accommodation so Bernadi's is a good balance of location and affordability. We stayed in the annex building, our room was spacious and furnished with period type bed head and dresser. The ensuite had a step to negotiate but was clean and in good condition. After having two nights of doing battle with mosquitoes we decided to keep the windows shut and get air in via the airconditioner. Our laptop could not connect with the hotel's internet so resorted to using their complimentary station in the corner of the dining room (first 10minutes is free). The dining room (at the hotel) is small and as breakfast is included its a popular place in the morning and so the reception area is utilised too. It can be a source of entertainment watching people check in, check out and listening to their comments and questions while chewing on your croissant. Overall we liked being in the annex - more space, less third party noise, close to supermarket, and had our own key (didn't have to keep returning it to reception). Venice is so unique, but the rumours of being expensive are kept in check by staying at Bernardi's and pre buying your lunch and snacks at the supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms, great price, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LuisBaptista
Reviews.Content: This is a average hotel with small rooms and a poor breakfast with no ham!! Is very clean and the position is good to go walk to the piazza San Marcos.

Reviews.Title: “Average.”
Reviews.Author: MelCarv
Reviews.Content: Considering Venice is ridiculously expensive I think we received a relatively good deal however the staff was nin in the least bit helpful. They rushed us through check in and when we asked additional questions the lady at the front desk kept saying thank you sir and we followed her thinking she was showing us to her room but instead she went to scrubbing a toilet. They failed to tell us that the main doors close at midnight. This would have been a great piece of advice. Luckily we rang the door bell and an angry gentleman let us in begrudgingly. We think you were suppose to leave your room key at front desk each day but we were never told and didn't bother to ask as they were difficult to find and harder to speak with. English wasn't a problem, it seemed they just didn't have the time. The room was clean and quaintly furnished. I found the rooms in the annex were actually nicer. If you like them in facebook you get a bottle of Prosecco. We were given a random bottle if wine instead. Breakfast was mediocre, probably the least enjoyable from all our 10 hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, affordable”
Reviews.Author: 254fam
Reviews.Content: We needed a budget hotel for our 2 nights in Venice. We also needed a room for 4. This hotel was in a good location. On a quiet street just off the main street, not far from the Rialto. We found the hotel to be very clean. The woman that worked the reception was very kind and helpful (spoke excellent English). Our room was tight, as was expected. We were thankful for the ac. We did a room with shared bath which was fine for 2 nights. The shared bath was very clean and we actually never saw anyone else using it. I found the bed to be pretty uncomfortable but okay for a short stay. We spent most of our time out exploring so really needed a place to crash each night. The breakfast could use some help. It was included in our room rate but I cannot imagine paying for it. There is an excellent restaurant almost next door to the hotel (I think Casa Mia)....inexpensive for Venice and excellent quality. We were supposed to have wifi but we could never get it to work in our room (3 floors up)....we were able to sit in the lobby area if we did need to access wifi. Overall the hotel was good for a budget property in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “NIce location but some drawbacks....”
Reviews.Author: lisacmaryland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week based on reasonably good Trip Advisor reviews. Indeed, the location and price are very good. You are not far from the Strata Novae which has excellent restaurants and shopping. St. Marks, Rialto Bridge are not a bad walk. We stayed in an annex to the main hotel. Yes, the stairs are steep and there are plenty of them. Probably not a good choice for elderly/infirm. The rooms are lovely and have pretty furniture. Bathrooms are new and cleaning was done promptly. A few reasons why I couldn't give this a better review: the mosquito situation was awful. Perhaps this is just June in Venice, but every night before bed the whole family was involved in killing as many mosquitoes as we could before turning in. We killed 10 - 12 each night for the 3 nights we were there. We kept all doors closed and covered the bathroom drains, but to no avail. Management was not helpful and had no ideas. The breakfast was blah. Never a clean place to sit, selection of food was poor. One poor lady frantically trying to keep up with everything. Lastly, the attitude of the mangers ranged from indifferent to surly. I always got the feeling like I was bugging them when I asked basic questions or needed help. I see from their website that they've been in business for quite awhile and maybe they're just burned out from dealing with tourists, but seeing Venice is a dream vacation for many, our family included, and they kind of soured my impression of the people who live and work there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-fair value for money”
Reviews.Author: jobeam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here having booked by email at the last minute. They replied immediately and communications were good. I was charged 32 euros per room ( 2 euros more than advertised internet price- but still very cheap for Venice) The location is fabulous-very close to supermarket and good cafe's. Close also to vaporetto stop. The room was tiny-the bed a bit soft ( a fold out camp style bed) but having cotton sheets-extra pillow and a sink in the room etc made a difference.- For the price it is everything that is needed IF you are out all day and only need a place to sleep and a bit of privacy. Cleanliness was quite good. Showers were upstairs, and shared, but it was manageable. The lady who runs it is lovely- very helpful in providing little things to help her guests, if asked. The Gentleman is more reserved but very polite. Free internet for first 20 minutes- enough to check emails etc. OK breakfast-with yoghourt and jugs of coffee- not the strongest Italian coffee in the city- but a fair start to the day. One of the evening staff ( young guy) was a bit rude-seemed a bit put out initially when I interrupted his internet session to ask for help, and I get the impression that if you are lucky enough to get the managers the service is good- but the fill in evening staff can be a bit erratic service wise. All in all I would stay here again-but I would be recommending it more highly if the beds/mattresses were replaced with new ones. Comfort of the mattress was something that might make me think twice about booking again. Also- dealing with tourists must be annoying sometimes, but it would be nice if some of the staff didn't make it so obvious. The lady who runs the hotel clearly has had lots of experience in hospitality and making people feel welcome, but the rest of the staff could learn from her. Really good location and as I say, the lady manageress of the hotel just couldn't be nicer or more helpful. She is a saving grace and some of the upstairs rooms looked nice. They are working hard to give fair value for money. A great budget option in a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: KimWS
Reviews.Content: No lift at this hotel and staircases are quite steep. Breakfast was basic with long-life croissants and not a lot of variety. Location was good - just off the main pedestrian street and close to Ca D'Oro vaporetto stop. The staff were quite helpful. Wi-fi free but only good reception was in common area downstairs. Lonely Planet recommended this hotel and it is therefore often fully booked. We paid 94 euros a night which I suppose is not too bad for Venice, but didn't think that was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're desperate”
Reviews.Author: Epiclady
Reviews.Content: I paid for the cheapest single room. Unfortunately I saw 1 bed bug in my bed, so I slept without blankets with the lights on. This worked and I had no bites the next day. The room itself is decent, seemed pretty clean. The shower could be better- not a lot of space. Customer service could be better. The lady who checked me in could have been friendlier, it was obvious she was in a bad mood. On the upside, breakfast was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet location away from the hordes of tourists”
Reviews.Author: lcohen9
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bernardi provided a perfect oasis from the busier areas of Venice. EASY access from the Fondimento Nuovo stop when arriving via boat from the airport - only 2 small bridges. Also an easy walk from the Ca D'oro vaporetto stop (if you arrive by train take the vaporetto - don't walk - it's a fairly long walk with bags). We stayed in the annex which is just around the corner from the main entrance. The privacy of this location was quite nice. We felt like we were staying in an apartment. Clean and newly renovated room. My only complaint is the mediocre breakfast - typical "american" style coffee (weak) and packaged baked items. The staff was adequate - not overly friendly but helpful when we had questions. Wifi is only available in the reception area (a good excuse to "disconnect" while on vacation but available when needed).

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good value and excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: FredDeMan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located midway between the Rialto and Ca D'Oro vaporetti stops, so within easy walking distance of almost all Venice destinations. Only a few 'blocks' from the airport shuttle boat stop at Fundamenta Nove too. The lobby looks fairly dingy, but the rooms, at least in the Annexe, are large, well decorated, and fully equipped. The breakfast is typical (i.e. pastry and coffee). The staff are very friendly, and we had no difficulty leaving our luggage while we explored. The prices are modest, especially for what you get. Best value we could find in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Colona1988
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about visiting Venice because I dislike crowds, so Hotel Bernardi Semenzato was perfect with its back street location. I agree with all the positive comments made by other reviewers. Our room (26, I think) was at the top of the building; it was quiet and surprisingly large by European standards. The price was great. Hotel Bernard Semenzato helped me fall in love with Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Missed the sign, but worth the effort to find!”
Reviews.Author: julsedslo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bernardi for three nights in May. The room was spacious,bed comfortable, lovely chandelier over the bed, the bathroom clean and the wifi worked in the room. There was a computer in the breakfast room, complimentary use until 10 pm. The breakfast room was kept clean and constantly refreshed by one to two lovely servers each day. We enjoyed the yogurt, juice, and breakfast danish,cheeses and nutella (generic-I think) Juice, and your choice of coffee or tea was wonderful, I enjoyed the cappuccino each morning, made to order. The room was spacious but the shower a bit small, but not uncomfortable. The only drawback was the small bar/restaurant across the walkway was a bit loud at night until 10:30 pm. This happened two of the three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Pack your ear plugs - beware solo travellers”
Reviews.Author: The_Bridge99
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a very affordable option for solo travellers who want to stay on the main island. However, I think all the single rooms are on the ground floor and appear to be of a lower quality than the rooms upstairs. There is absolutely no sound insulation in the rooms - which also presents a problem being down on the ground floor. The hotel also seems to be frequented by students who treat the place more like a sociable hostel or boarding house. Expect to be woken up by the coffee machine and people having breakfast in the morning. There is also not a shower on the ground floor. The only shower on the first floor only let out a drip. But the one on the second is fine. However, if none of this bothers you it is a great location for the affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Venice for â‚¬65”
Reviews.Author: kari46
Reviews.Content: Paid â‚¬65 for a double with a shared bathroom, included light breakfast. Stayed on 2nd floor, wifi was spotty in room, worked good downstairs in lobby. Woke up during the night to Mosquitos buzzing in my ear. Had to keep window open for ventilation. You have to leave your key with clerk when leave hotel during your stay, which I do not like. We walked to/from train station. We had large backpacks only, I think traveling with more luggage than that would be difficult anywhere in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graffox
Reviews.Content: Nice cheap hotel. We lived in an additional case with a good view out the window. Comfortable room, pleasant service. Breakfast was modest

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay elsewhere in Venice”
Reviews.Author: shannonrana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the second time, as we were so impressed with the location, friendliness of staff, value and comfort of this hotel. Although this time around we were not in the Annex ( we will ask for it on our next trip, as it is more quite and you don't have to worry about coming in late), we were once again impressed with Hotel Bernardi and would not stay anywhere else. Where else can you stay in the middle of everything, next to great restaurants (especially the one one building away...can't remember the name), near a couple of vaporetto stops and the Rialto bridge, and still be happy with the cost, comfort and cleanliness of your hotel. Nowhere else....that is where!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended but Print out a map of the hotel location !!”
Reviews.Author: AcrossContinents
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel's triple room with bath which was located a few minutes walk from the main hotel building and was overjoyed with the room. The location was perfect (once u've figured out the location of the hotel) It was walking distance to all sights, close to the Rialto bridge and yet extremely quiet, perfect for a good night's rest. The room & bathroom ; beautiful, very clean, spacious. My tip would be to print out a map of the hotel as everyone we asked did not know where the hotel was located, and venice has a series of winding streets. Antoher hitch was that there was free wifi at the main building but none at the building we were at. All in all, a great find, extremely good value for money !

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: StephanieHargreaves
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay here. it was an awesome location right near all the good restaurants and sights. the room was spacious and clean. the staff were helpful. the breakfast was ok. really good for what you pay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not so great room, bathroom or service”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter1114
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights during carnivale. The room was advertised to have breakfast but because we booked online we were not given breakfast. The location of hotel is good. It's not too hard to find and it's close to walk to the rialto bridge. There is also a good restaurant a few steps away. Room itself was small. We were situated close to the bathroom which was a huge drawback. It was super noisy since it was a shared bathroom so we heard the flush every time someone went in. We also had to use this one since our room did not include a bathroom. We're unsure how many people use this bathroom but we had to wait a long time just to access it. I still can't believe there was only one shower and one toilet for a number of rooms! The thermostat was located in the hallway. One night we woke up sweating so we went outside to notice someone had switched it to 28 degrees celcius. All in all, a decent price for the room for the location. Unfortunately, we were not given breakfast, room was small and hot and the bathroom situation was a mess. I would only recommend this hotel if you are on a tight budget

Reviews.Title: “UNFORGETTABLE STAY!”
Reviews.Author: mil18
Reviews.Content: i totally recomend this hotel as it combines everything.very reasonable prices, perfect location close to everything in the centre of Venice,VERY CLEAN and a great manager and owner MR leo.Mr leo thank u very much for everything

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: worldwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early November 2010. It is just on the edge of the historic district but without the high prices. We were on the 2nd floor of the annex. Very secure and comfortable. No internet in the room but it was available during the day in the breakfast room. There was an internet cafe just across the street which was cheap and accessible. There is a really great restaurant close by.is within walking distance to 2 water taxi/vaporetto stops. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So good to be back at the Hotel Bernardi!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Paul_UK
Reviews.Content: After eight years we finally managed to keep our promise to ourselves to return to Venice and the Hotel Bernardi, and I'm glad to say that we weren't disappointed. The staff were as friendly as ever, as were the owners - who I believe have owned the hotel since the 1980's. As ever, the value for money and location can't be bettered in our opinion, just a short walk to the Rialto Bridge and the Grand Canal. Following tips and comments in other reviews here, we stayed in the "annexe" and were well pleased with the quality on offer. A huge tiled lobby gave access to the rooms, and while ours wasn't en-suite we actually had a bathroom for our exclusive use just three steps from our room. Being November we had varied weather to say the least! A combination of rain and high tides (I assume seeing as water was coming *up* out of the pavements in places) meant that some portions of Venice were under water for part of the day. One morning we found water inches deep outside the annexe's front door, but all was saved by our breakfast server / chambermaid who asked our shoes sizes and came back five minutes later with wellington boots for us both. A few last comments about the breakfast, which seems to have been an issue for some. For one thing, it is *included* in what is already a very competitive price for a hotel in Venice - I've known other continental hotels charge 5 or 6 euros per person for not much more than you get here. Secondly, it's a buffet so you can just keep helping yourselves if you want! Note that fresh bread rolls are now included, along with the filled croissants (OK, so they're plastic wrapped), yoghurt, preserves, orange juice (OK, so it's from concentrate) and hot drink. One thing we spotted this time that had escaped our notice before is that there is more on offer than the simple tea/coffee choice we assumed - simply ask for espresso, latte, macchiato or cappucino if you prefer. So, eight years on and just as good as ever, if not better.

Reviews.Title: “great views, close to rialto bridge/san polo”
Reviews.Author: kadub
Reviews.Content: in the carnareggio part of venice, close to rialto bridge/san polo area, rooms were very roomy, clean, w/ super helpful front desk lady. the old guy we spoke to trying to get directions to the airport was not so helpful. we got the corner room in the annex building (residence leo), quiet, amazing views, all new appliances. at 126Euro for 2 nights total, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Situated Budget Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: KRB222
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently spent 10 days traveling through Europe, including 1 night (2 full days) in Venice, where we stayed at Hotel Bernardi. We were looking for a budget hotel that was centrally located (and clean!) and this was perfect. This is a small hotel on a very narrow street, but it's just steps from a busy piazza and just a few minutes' walk to the Grand Canal. We took the water bus (#1) from the train station and got off at the Ca d'Oro stop, and from there it was just a short walk. We were very happy with the location. The hotel itself was very cute. It's definitely in an old building with steep stairs (no elevator that we saw) but that contributes to the character. We paid extra for a room with a private ensuite bathroom which was definitely worth it. The room itself was nicely furnished and very clean, and the bathroom was basic but worked fine. No view out of our window (except into a window across the narrow alley) but that was just a product of being in Venice (and not staying right on the Grand Canal). We had very little interaction with the staff but they were friendly when we did and the breakfast was sufficient. They held our luggage for us until about 5pm on the day we checked out. I would definitely stay here again for the price; for a budget price range this was ideal for our needs. A couple side notes: Don't use internet directions when trying to find the hotel, use the hotel's directions as they are more accurate. Secondly, we ate lunch one day at Casa Mia, a little restaurant just down from the hotel, which was delicious and very cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the Cannaregio”
Reviews.Author: italia2007
Reviews.Content: Great hotel choice and really liked the Cannaregio area for being central enough to walk to main sights and yet not overrun with tourists. A short walk from the Ca' d'Oro vaporetto stop, which we needed carrying backpacks. Stayed in the annex building in a triple room which was also nice as we could come and go as we pleased and felt like having your own place in the city. Would definitely recommend Hotel Bernardi Semenzato for the friendly staff and location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Balakrishnan_K
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice in Sep 2010 and stayed at Hotel Bernardi for one night. The charming and friendly Maria at the front desk, a great location and very reasonable price made our stay memorable. If you're coming from the airport, the walk from the Fondamente Nove Alilaguna ferry stop to the hotel will give you a romantic introduction to Venice's charm. The location is great because it is not too touristy, yet only a 20 minute walk away from the main sights at Rialto and San Marco. Right opposite the hotel is a bar frequented by locals that serves good house wine and great cichetti (the Venice equivalent of Tapas). Rooms and loos are clean, breakfast is basic but good (coffee, croissants, cake and flavored yoghurt). No lift, has A/c, free internet for half an hour. Would definitely recommend it to budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “roomy, bath in room, but towels stink horribly!!”
Reviews.Author: love2travelbackpacki
Reviews.Content: we stayed 1 night, thought our room was booked for the main hotel, but the lady owner said no, took us to another hotel a few block away, room was roomy, which was nice, beds were okay, old worn, but sheets are clean and washed....bathroom inside room, which was really a plus! but the moment we checked in and paid, the lady owner walked off, and we didnt see her anymore. We could not get help with anything since no one is at front desk. Good thing we stayed only 1 night. When we checked out, we did it by ourselves, left the keys in room, and that's it. Kinda strange to run this biz......oh well, good thing not all hotels in Italy are like this. Oh, I almost forgot, the towels smell weird, like.....vinegar sour and stinky smell.....we never even dare touch them.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and friendly. These people know their business.”
Reviews.Author: ellabella66
Reviews.Content: The rate for a single with shared bathroom in high season is incredbly modest. Still, the little room in this small hotel in the heart of Venice was spotless and the staff friendly and helpfull. I can't name you any setbacks. This is not just value for money, this is an example for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Basic with great location & value”
Reviews.Author: Larry917
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights while exploring Venice on my own. The hotel was conveniently located but off the main route on a quiet tiny street. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast was basic but good (great coffee). I booked a little late (for Venice it seems) so I was in a room on the ground floor... very dark but quiet. Sink in room was handy. No bath (there were 2 baths with showers upstairs and it was not hard to get access most of the time). Bed was single, narrow, too soft. But hey, I was in Venice and I spent almost no time in the room! There was wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “simple hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: sams-trips
Reviews.Content: reasonably-priced and quite central, tucked away in a small street. stayed 2 nights in a double room without shower on 2nd floor. small room, a bit dark, but clean, sink in room, beds almost long enough for a tall person... shower on hallway a bit unpractical (not enough hooks to hang your clothes and stuff, shower curtain too high to prevent water from spraying on the floor). breakfast is included if you book over the hotel website (chocolate croissant, soft bread, biscuits, jam, etc.). bottled water available (I don't recommend drinking the tap water just to be safe). the staff is nice, but gets unnerved if you are not friendly with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful value, incredibly friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Paul_UK
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in April 2001 and again in November 2002 (when you had to book by sending them a fax!) but I just had to add our views of this little gem of a hotel which must be the best value in Venice. The rooms are perfectly acceptable and the staff extremely friendly and helpful, while the location is just superb - only minutes from the Rialto Bridge and just a short walk to the very centre of Venice. The icing on the cake is the incredible value for money that the Bernardi Semenzato offers - you could easily pay more to be stuck out somewhere like the Lido. On our second trip my companion was taken ill towards the end of our stay and we had to return home a day early. Despite the complete lack of notice the owner refused to charge us for the final night's stay, even though he would almost certainly have no chance to re-let the room on the same day. Nearly a decade on it is great to see that this hotel is still receiving the glowing reviews that it so richly deserves. We can't wait to make another visit to Venice later this year and there is only one hotel that we will be choosing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: rubyong
Reviews.Content: Travelling with friends from back home, the three of us needed a decent hotel to stay for the two nights we were in Venice after Paris. We thought that Hotel Bernardi Semenzato would be a good deal. The hotel was easy to get to, as instructions with diagrams were provided after we made the booking, via email confirmation. This place was a 3 minute walk from Ca d' Oca Vaparetto stop. The reception was neat and we were greeted by a friendly lady receptionist. The staff were all friendly and helpful. I liked the fact that there was no trouble in finding food in the area and there many shops and even a supermarket and ATM points. Our rooms were in an annex that was around the corner from the hotel reception. We were guided by the receptionist and had to walk up two tall fights of stairs to the upper level, to get to our rooms. The room was equipped with air-con (good for humid Venice), three neat single beds and a sparklingly clean modern bathroom with accompanying bidet! There was no bar fridge, but that was not a problem as there were plenty of places to buy drinks and food. Power points were sufficient but there was no internet in the rooms, only at the hotel reception lobby, which was most unfortunate (but free, nevertheless). I liked the fact that breakfast was provided in the price. The spread did not have a lot of variety but I was full at the end of the meal. I liked the bread roll better than the croissants that were in individually sealed bags (yuck!), even though both breads were cold, and not warm. They had orange juice which was nice, but was quickly finished as there was only one jug per time. There was always coffee or tea which complemented the meal. Overall, it was a very good stay for the money we paid and I look forward to visiting Italy again!

Reviews.Title: “Owner is a proud Millionaire!”
Reviews.Author: drsel
Reviews.Content: My wife & I arrived v. early at 7am & met the owner at the reception. He said he could give us our pre-booked room (@Euro54) only @12 noon. But we could leave our bags & explore Venice & he would try to keep a room ready @10am. He was mighty upset that I mistook the lady with him to be his wife--(she was the receptionist.). When we returned at 12.00, he was upset that we were late & told us we could go find another hotel. He said he didn't care for our 108 Euros (for 2 nights), since he owned many Italian mansions & was in fact a millionaire! He grumbled that what he was charging was peanuts for a room in costly Venice. Sensing that I had got off on a wrong note with an aristocratic Italian millionaire, I apologized both for my mistaken identity & for returning late. After that, he was in a better mood & told us he was giving us a much better room than what we had paid for. In fact, he gave us a room in the Annexe--which was actually much grander, a typical Venetian mansion with 4--5 rooms on the 1st 2n! The room itself was small &. clean with a portable AC & bathroom outside. The free breakfast was v. basic, but adequate--muffins, juice, coffee, tea, yoghurt, cookies. All in all, we tried our best to be friendly & greeted the owner/ spoke to him every morning. I also asked him a lot of questions about sightseeing in Venice (which he didn't have the patience to answer) Nevertheless, at checkout, he was v. pleasant & even gave us a 5% discount for cash payment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RAL617
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel with our 3 daughters and one son-in-law. Leonardo allowed to stow our luggage as we had arrived hours ahead of check-in. We got our rooms which all very clean and the air conditioning in our room on the front of the hotel was very efficient in the humid weather in Venice. Leonardo was very helpful in planning our return to the airport, but actually led us to the bus stop and carried one of our heavy suitcases (we had been traveling for 18 days)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: doubledown76
Reviews.Content: This small little hotel is located within a 2 minute walk off the Ca d' Oca Vaparetto stop in an amazing residential neighborhood in the Canneregio neighborhood. We stayed in an annex just around the corner with a modern bathroom and shower. It was very recently remodeled, but still had some nice Venetian touches. The breakfast was decent, but hey, with the prices in Venice, it was nice not to have to worry about breakfast too. All in all, you can't find a better location for the price in Venice!! And directly across from the hotel is an awesome Osteria that has a decent chin chin buffet, and the cheapest drink prices we found in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “true value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: vaishu4
Reviews.Content: i was so pleased to see the hotel once we reached there. initially i was sceptical since i just went with a 'word of mouth' about this hotel and i booked through the net. but it was a pleasure to stay there, right in the heart of veince island. the location was just perfect. also the price was totally worth the stay. would surely recommend this hotel. only thing we were not to happy was the kind of breakfast that they served and there was no room service available. we were totally 7 adults and 2 kids (7yrs and 11yrs). the quadruple rooms easily accomodate 4 adults and 1 child of 11 yrs. you just need to specify to them. there is no lift so be ready to carry your luggage atleast 2 floors!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “more like a youth hostel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: bootnewman
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Bernardi was very good, and the staff was generally pleasant. But the rooms were more like the sort of places I stayed in when I was backpacking around as a college student 15 years ago than like a real hotel. I recognize that the rates are on the low side for Venice, so I wasn't expecting anything particularly luxurious. The rooms were clean enough, but our room was tiny, dark, and shabby. It bore no resemblance to any of the photos on the website. It was also very loud in the hotel: all night and early in the morning we could hear people walking, talking, and laughing. The website advertised free internet access, but they claimed the free code wasn't working and charged 15 euros/hour to use the wifi. Breakfast consisted of plastic-wrapped croissants. We had friends staying in another hotel that was only 10 euros more and a million times nicer, and another friend staying in a pension that was 35 euros less and about the same. Perhaps we just got an unusually bad room or came during a bad week, but this was one of the most unpleasant hotel stays I have had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation ...apart from the last night :(”
Reviews.Author: Hayles_Lou91
Reviews.Content: We flew into Venice and got the bus into the City. From the Bust Stop, it was quite a long walk with heavy luggage but the hotel wasnt too hard to find. The staff were more than happy to help us and even provided a map of the city for our stay in Venice. The location was excellent as the hotel was close to main attractions but was set back slightly from the main streets, making it a quiet retreat. The breakfast provided was also a perfect way to start a day exploring. When we booked our stay, it was only possible to have a double room with a bathroom for three nights (as opposed the the intened four nights). We therefore booked this room for three nights and booked a double with a shared bathroom for the final night. Our first room was set on the top floor and was lovely. It was clean, comfortable and spacious. However, when it came to the final night, we were moved to a twin in a small room on the ground floor. The room was small, rather cold and quite noisy as it was close to the breakfast room and the alleys beside the hotel. Until this point, i felt happy with the facilities and service provided at the hotel; however, I felt a bit cheated when we were pot in a brrom cuprboard for our final night!

Reviews.Title: “Single bedrooms need a seperate review!”
Reviews.Author: daveifbyland
Reviews.Content: I chose to book a single bedroom at the Hotel Bernardi rather than going to a hostel because I wanted to be able to rest well during my two nights in Venice. The problem with single bedrooms at Hotel Bernardi is that there don't seem to be very many of them, and one of them (my room) is located on the ground floor in the lobby, almost directly next to the kitchen. Needless to say, this was a major disappointment, as I expected that paying 30-35 euros (versus 20-25 for a hostel dorm room) would buy me some peace and quiet. I was clearly mistaken. Beware single travelers that you will be rolling the dice with Hotel Bernardi and may end up with the room I did, awakened each morning by the hotel staff noisily preparing for breakfast. To be fair, the room is clean and comfortable. But it did not wow me enough to make up for its unfortunate location. If you're on a budget, save your money in Venice and sleep in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: matetaur
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best value in Venice. Very central. Very small room but this is the norm here... Breakfast better avoided, there is much better deal near the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but service was a challenge.”
Reviews.Author: BrightTraveler09
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bernardi in Venice is a nice hotel but the staff is a little behind the times as far as service. They appear to do reservations by pen and pad and not computer so reservations can be misplaced. The staff mixed our groups reservations or lost them, but they were able to room enough beds for all in the end. Make sure you get confirmations in writing and double check reservation a day or two before arrival to make sure they have you down. Rooms in the Annex building are bigger and nicer. Overall, this is a nice, clean hotel, close to water bus stop Ca d'Or and some very nice resturants.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: NOT-Stuck-in-India
Reviews.Content: Considering that this is one of the cheapest hotels you will find in the Venice area, I want to start off by saying that in order to stay here, you have to expect to get what you pay for. It is not a 3 or even a 2 star hotel, and I don't think they advertise it as one. So go into it with your expectation being less than average, and I think you'll enjoy your time there. The staff was somewhat abrupt, although were able to answer the questions we had -- most of the time though, we felt like we were bothering them when we needed something. The location is very good which was the reason I had booked here in the first place -- and it is also Lonely Planet recommended -- although, they may need to reevaluate their recommendation. Overall I gave this stay an average rating. I feel that since we booked a 1 star type property, and for way under $200 USD which is what most hotels in Venice will cost, we got what we paid for! On another note, although Venice is a beautiful place and one that I'm happy we visited...it was EXTREMELY touristy! Very disappointing that the restaurants, and stores cater to tourist so much to the point that I wasn't sure if I was in the US eating, or in Italy! If you are deciding whether or not to visit Venice, just make sure you are prepared for a tourist experience. If you aren't really into a packed tourist destination, I'd suggest somewhere else in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Check it out!!”
Reviews.Author: lellybean
