Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here. Very happy with the front desk clerk, she was so friendly and helpful!! Great location, within easy walking distance to everything, as well as just a short ride on the waterbus from the airport. Rooms are small and basic, but clean and tidy. We made the mistake of leaving the windows open overnight and woke up covered in mosquito bites!! Amazing restaurant directly across the street, run by two young men, serving delicious food! Try the pumpkin ravioli!! Hotel breakfast isn't too bad, breads, yogurt, coffee, etc. Free wifi in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, good location, reasonable rates.”
Reviews.Author: celena73
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through your trip advisor. Review on hotel very good & true. Staff was helpful. We stayed in Annex very new, but there are 2 flights of steps & no elevator. But if you don't mind that, very nice around corner from hotel & a six minute walk to the Fountemante Nuove, where boats go out to airport marco polo & islands of Murano & Burano. Only little problem we had was day we left, asked for a 7:00 am wake up call, needed to make boat to airport & 2 connecting flights home. Never got wake up call, luckily I woke up earlier, could not sleep, so was not a problem. Something must have gone wrong with their phones, don't really know. So maybe just bring back up alarm, other than that, staff helpful, especially the young girl receptionist.. We arrived on sunday afternoon, the person there at that time did not understand english very well. But nice, carried my luggage upto 2nd floor of annex. Breakfast was also decent, for the usually breakfast you get in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, rude staff, and dark dank room”
Reviews.Author: percheno9
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room with a shared bathroom for three nights. I had read other reviews on Trip Advisor and so was prepared for a very basic room. When I arrived at the Hotel I had to wait 15 minutes for the reception clerk to return to his desk....he was outside on his cell phone. The room itself was on the first floor of the hotel just off the reception area and the breakfast area. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything through them. Even people snoring at night in the room next to you. The afternoon of my first arrival I was exhausted and wanted to rest before exploring Venice. As I tried to nap, it became impossible as the reception clerk was having a very loud conversation with someone in the reception area. I waited, hoping the talking would subside, after a half-hour the conversation continued. I went to the clerk and explained that I was tired and trying to rest and that it was quite loud. He shrugged his shoulders and said it would be quiet at night, then he continued to talk with what appeared to be his entire family who were sitting in the reception area. It was quiet at night starting around 10pm, but at 6am the noise began again as they started to set up for breakfast. The staff spoke to each other in loud voices as they set up with no concern for those who were sleeping just a few feet away. The room itself smelled badly of cheap air freshiners and it was stuffy with no air flow. There was no ac, which I knew when I booked the room, but what I didn't know was that if you open the windows in Venice at night you will get eaten alive by mosquitoes. I traveled throughout Italy for three weeks and stayed at many places with rooms in the 35 euro range, which is what I paid at Hotel Bernardi, and none were as bad as this. My suggestion if you're on a budget is to at least splurge in Venice. It's such a crowded city, having a clean, quiet space to come back to will make your trip that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PCMBB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for three nights and our room was on the top floor of the main building. It was a double room with bathroom. The room was very nice, the aircon worked perfectly, the lighting was good, the room was spacious and clean. No funny smells, as sometuimes happens in carpeted rooms. The TV didn't work, I think the remote was broken or something, but we didn't bother to complain since we wouldn't watch much of it anyway. As usual in old buildings, the hotel had no lift, so we had to carry our bags. Breakfast was ok. The staff was generally helpful and friendly, although I did get the impression that they don't like too much when guests get back to the hotel late. There's a curfew at midnight, but they let you take a spare key if you plan to return later than that; however, you have to plan it in advance and leave a document with them (we left our drivers licenses). The location is good, but Venice is so small that it's hard to be far from anything. You can walk to Rialto and San Marco, or you can take a boat. There's a vaporetto stop nearby (Ca D'Oro), so it's easy to come and go, and the night vaporetto stops there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably rude and unsympathetic”
Reviews.Author: JimmyGBristol_UK
Reviews.Content: Following a fantastic week in Slovenia in accommodation in the mountains with the best hosts/owners I've ever experienced we finished off with two nights in Venice at the Bernardi. As a family of four we booked a quad room and were taken to the annexe. No complaints on the room and it was what we expected. Yes, breakfast is meagre and there is very little welcoming hospitality but hey, we're not too fussy! However, on our second night one of the children was terribly ill (another had been equally ill with a virus in Slovenia). Without going into detail we had to change the bedding completely, which I was able to do and leave no mess at all in the room. The spoilt bedding was placed outside the room on an open landing in one pile......we didn't know what else to do at 2 am. We didn't throw it out without thinking or place it where the cleaners might not find it. My wife was also poorly during the night and I was too on the flight back. Sorry Mr Bernardi but we had a virus, these things happen. The next morning I went to reception as we were meant to check out at 10.30 (which, incidentally is a bit early in my opinion). I asked if we could stay an extra hour in the room as two of us had been ill and were struggling. The stoney-faced male receptionist could hardly bring himself to look at me and said he was aware of the illness as the cleaners had informed him about the sheets and bedding. I apologised and he asked me what was wrong with the bathroom if someone was ill as it was in the room. I explained that the bathroom wasn't in the room but through a door and down a 10 metre hallway. A small child does not have the presence of mind to prevent themselves from being sick and wandering out of a pitch black room. He was surly and had no interest in my explanation, nor did he ask how we were. I told him to forget it and we'd be out by 10.30, although he then belatedly said no, it's okay for another 30 minutes. We were able to leave our bags in the dining room with those of other guests but that wasn't an exceptional service afforded to us. I have never experienced such rudeness from a hotel member of staff. I have no idea if it was the owner or not. I'd be interested to see what sort of spin the hotel puts on this review as they seem mightily defensive. As I have said, I have no complaints about the place in general and I'm very sorry the illness caused inconvenience. However, there is little personality about the place and the website tries to be touchy, feely and stress the family factor. In closing, I'd like to reiterate that we had no option but to strip the bed and dispose of the bedding as well as we could. We are a responsible family who do consider others which is more than I can say for the San Bernardi. I can only guess at what they might say in reply but it's my word against Mr Misery who I'd like to meet up with again for a little chat!

Reviews.Title: “Best Room in Venice--For the Money: Value, Value, Value!”
Reviews.Author: EvilTwin2000
Reviews.Content: There's plenty to gripe about at Hotel Bernardi if you're so inclined. But I'm not and here's why: for a few Euros more than a hostel, I stayed in a clean, private, centrally located room. And that's the bottom line. Travellers looking for anything more--and you know who you are--should probably look elsewhere or you will be disappointed. But for a small step up in ammenities, you'll be paying triple the price of the humble Hotel Bernardi. The shower and WC weren't just down the hall--they were on another floor! The breakfast is utterly skippable, as it's mostly goods wrapped in plastic. And the room was no great shakes. But it was still better than I expected, as I booked only two weeks ahead and was told in advance that they had only one room left. I was expecting a converted broom closet, and it was far better than that. But guess what? It just doesn't matter. At these prices--and I'm afriad to tell you exactly what I paid for two weekdays in late June, for fear you won't be able to get quite as good a deal--you can go out for breakfast and still be tens of Euros ahead of the game. I had no idea there was any room in Venice that was this inexpensive. It's truly an incredible value, virtually unbelieveable in this high-priced city. Aside from it's location, a short walk from the Ca D'Oro vaperetto stop, price is the only reason to stay here. But it's a heckuva good reason, don't you think? I'm sure not complaining. It has to be the best bargain in Venice and that's good enough for me. I'm bound to return if I can get anywhere near the same deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bernardi provided excellent accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: karenatlantaga
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Bernardi was wonderful. The staff was attentive to our needs and provided excellent service. The rooms were spotless, tastefully furnished, and the accommodations comfortable. The location is quiet, perfect for anyone who wants to be out of the frenzy of tourist traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and service for a fair price”
Reviews.Author: gdltec
Reviews.Content: My wife, our three kids and I stayed at a room located about two blocks from the main building of the hotel. The room was very spacious, it had two windows overlooking one of Venice's canals, the bathroom was clean and the hotel even offered Wifi at the main building! The breakfast was enough, milk, coffee, chocolate, bread, yogurt, croissants, etc... Leonardo (person at the desk - manager/owner) was very kind, he was very helpful when we had questions about Venice in general, spoke English and he also left us store our luggage after we checked out so we could spent our last day in Venice walking around without carrying our luggage. The hotel is located in the district ig Cannaregio, it is a 15 minute walk from the train station and it is within walking distance of all Venice major attractions such as the San Marco plaza, Rialto bridge, shops, restaurants, etc... They even offer a 5% discount if you pay your stay with cash.

Reviews.Title: “A central location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: thirty8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Bernardi for 3 nights in June 2009. It is only stone flow from the CaDOro water taxis stop and relatively easy to find. It is at an alley way so there is no river view from the hotel room. This would be the reason that room is relatively cheap : 35 Euro for single room with shared toilet and shower facilities. It is centrally located : within walking distance to Rialto Bridge or S Marco Piazzo. There are several good eating places and pubs nearby. I did find the place noisy during my stay because of renovation works in the next-door building starting at 8am in the morning. The breakfast is like continental breakfast which is basic. The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful and they gives many ideas of places to visit and dine. If you only want a place to stay without high expectations, this hotel is the right one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: TeacherandDad
Reviews.Content: Our quad room was in the annex about two blocks from the hotel. It was one of our favorite rooms in Italy - great antique feel and comfortable. It was very large, bright, and had a nice view of a walled garden across the lane. The high ceilings had ornate crown molding and the floor was an lovely wood parquet. The bathroom was small, but very clean and modern. Guests are given a key to the building and to the room for security. The staff was excellent - the young woman at the front desk was very welcoming, friendly and helpful - she offered good suggestions for restaurants and things to do. The breakfast was quite plain, mostly prepackaged fare. However, we had to leave early on our last day and the staff was more than happy to give us pastries and juice the night before. The location was nice in that it was a couple blacks off the main tourist streets - just behind the wonderful Campo Apostoli ( a square with a beautiful church, some nice shops and shaded public benches). Very near our room was a neighborhood away from the tourist area where we found a supermarket, a great bakery and a wine shop. The wine shop was particularly great as customers could bring in their own liter or half liter bottles and have them filled from large vats of various kinds of wine for a great price (most were about two Euro for a liter). The local wines were particularly good. Another positive to the location was the proximity to what I would call the center of the city - the Rialto Bridge. It was about a 5-8 minute walk. St Mark's was about 20-25 mintutes. The walking times are very subjective as it is difficult to just make a beeline for a location when there are so many interesting shops, tempting stops for food and drink, and absolutely captivating canal and architectural scenes all along the way. The only slightly negative aspect to the location is the distance from the train station. It was a major 20-25 minute hike with luggage or what I would consider an expensive 6.50 Euro per person vaporetto ride. However, it was well worth it to be in such a great part of the city. You must see Venice - and the Hotel Barnardi Semenzato is a wonderful if you are looking for a good value and nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a dump”
Reviews.Author: veryscary
Reviews.Content: The only things worse than the room was the nasty men at the desk and the frightful breakfast. Not to mention the huge fight outside the hotel when we were checking out. I spoke to three different couples in the breakfast room that felt the same way I did. I got some very bad advise from your site

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful stay in venice!”
Reviews.Author: mistrafu
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the hotel bernardi semenzato. We thought the hotel provided very good value for the money, considering the prices in Venice. It was very well located the staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was more than enought. we stayed in a very big room that was well decorated and estremely clean. We would without a doubt book the same hotel next time

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Sareli
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in Venice! The staff were helpful and kind, the hotel was very quite,very clean and well presented. moreover it was perfectly located (5 mins walking from Rialto's bridge). breakfast were also good, milk, toast, choco, coffee,bread,croissant,juce, yogurt, u could have all what u wanted. during my trip in rome, venice, florence and paris, this hotel was the most excellent one, and iÂ´ll warmy recommend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Beds were awful, no a/c working - we were in the annex”
Reviews.Author: boobubble
Reviews.Content: We were greeted at the desk and then we were walked a few blocks away to stay in the "annex". it was a little creepy - rooms were spacious, but the beds were horrible - literally springs were poking us. Mattresses were very thin and beds were on crooked legs. Room was musty and my son's allergies went into overdrive. The wall AC was broken, so they had a floor unit hooked up. It beeped off and on all night and then leaked all over the floor. The desk clerk had no idea what to do and laid a towel down to catch the water. This unit held gallons of water - and we were afraid of the damage to the lovely floors so my husband figured out how to reconnect the drain tube, but we still had no AC and it was HOT. Too noisy to keep the windows open. Bathroom was not so great - shower was weak. Not so great hotel. We paid 170 euros for one night, for two rooms. The woman at the front desk was very nice however, but the man they left on duty overnight to help was kind of useless - didn't speak english well and didn't know or seem to care about our comfort or the hardwood floors being ruined. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Even if you have a very tight budget, this is still no value for money.”
Reviews.Author: PikoVancouver
Reviews.Content: Dear Reader, This hotel is not good value for your money. The rooms are basic and not that clean. We found broken glass on the floor and, to the hotel's credit, the staff were very attentive when we mentioned it to them. The location is fine, with easy access to the grand canal. The staff are not very friendly and helpful (with the exception of the glass incident) and, in addition, do not know much. The breakfast was quite bad- they did not even give you plates, we used our saucers. Most of the bread items were pre-packaged.

Reviews.Title: “Pay close attention-difference in locations; annex vs. main hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAround19341
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the main, original hotel. We spent 3 nights there. Apparently there is a huge difference between the accommodations of the main hotel where we stayed and the â€œannex.â€� I picked out the hotel based upon the rave reviews. However the graffiti on the side of the hotel by the entrance should say it all. The room was loud (room #5 a Triple) as the next building is literally 3 feet away and everyone keeps their windows open and you can hear it all from the homes and street. If I had a measuring tape, I could've gotten an accurate measurement on the depth of the dust on top of the headboards which where just beneath shoulder level so very visible. The mildew/mold on the bathroom walls/shower stall was another issue. The decor was severely dated and ill used. The photos must have been taken long ago on the website. Most times we came back to the hotel there was no one at the front desk and we just simply took our room key, (no elevator) which of course means that anyone else could do the very same; not a comforting thought at all. Upon check-in the receptionist made me aware that she knew of the food allergy which I submitted at the time of the reservation made months in advance to the manager, but he decided not to accommodate it; so I paid for food which I could never eat. If this is run by a family, we never saw them. Out of curiosity we went to the annex and couldn't believe the difference. The annex is much, much better. Needless to say we felt like we had gotten ripped off after paying for a triple. Point being, only stay here at the main hotel if you are on a string shoe budget. Otherwise, yes, you can do much better. (or get a guarantee that you'll be in the annex of course)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: r6ryder
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights (friday and saturday) in a single room ($35/night) by myself with a sink. Toilet and shower were upstairs in a single bathroom but never had a problem not being able to use it. The whole place was very clean and kept up well. Only issue I had was that my room was one of the two located downstairs and the walls were thin - breakfast area and lobby are right there so it was somewhat loud in the morning. Breakfast was decent - just your basic pasty/bread and coffee/OJ. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Location was good too - not in the center of Venice but not too far away. Small alley that the front is located in is right off one of the major plazas and the alley has 2 small italian restaurants and 1 cool bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorhs
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the annex in another building a couple blocks from the main hotel. Large room. The breakfast was ok: juice, different breads, coffee & sometimes yogurt. We used the wi-fi at the main hotel twice. The vaporetto stop is near and the main sites within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, charming and GREAT coffee with breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EmilyS81
Reviews.Content: Venice is NOT cheap.However, I think that you get your money's worth at Hotel Bernardi. It was relatively easy to find...given that nothing is easy to find in Venice. Remember that a tiny alley is considered a street and you will do fine! We got a room in the "Annex" which was actually another building completely, and this allowed us to have our own keys and come and go as we pleased. Breakfast was simple, the usual European basket of bread, juice and yogurt. However, the coffee they give you is amazing and worth the stay. If you are staying in a room on the main floor, it is noisey, so if you are sensitive, request a room away from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: unspooling
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bernardi Semenzato made our stay in the magical city of Venezia even better. The location was quiet and tucked in. We were given one of the best rooms (in the annex) and it was such a lovely and spacious room - really, it was pretty much a suite. A huge, very old-looking but elegant chandelier was easily the centerpiece of our room. The wallpaper matched the upholstery and even the duvet covers. Very, very classy. Service was superb.

Reviews.Title: “In view of the tariff we expected little but we were enchanted”
Reviews.Author: venusbathstravel
Reviews.Content: When making our travel plans this hotel had very ordinary reviews but we were delighted with our room in what they call 'the annexe', just a few metres from the main hotel, (where breakfast is served and free internet is available). The annexe is situated on the first floor; there is no lift. We certainly didn't expect the room to be so lovely, the entry foyer is enormous and has marble floors and antique furniture. Our bathroom was next to our room, but that was explained when we booked late. The place was quiet and elegant; we were thrilled with it. The airconditioning was good. The staff were all helpful, including the breakfast staff who spoke only Italian. Breakfast was fine, not exciting but OK. Make sure you see the canal beside the annexe at dusk, and do eat at the restaurant in the narrow alley very close to the hotel. The baked fish for two was exquisite. There is a supermarket quite close - walk away from the hotel with the canal behind you and you'll find it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, family owned and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hopkj142
Reviews.Content: This was a great find in Venice. Very convenient location and the family that owned it was helpful and as friendly as you can expect from an Italian family - they were quiet and reserved, but available when needed. We stayed in the "annex" that overlooked a nice garden. Very reasonably priced and extremely CLEAN!!! Newly renovated rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: krazyk9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit tricky to find, tucked away in one of the narrow and winding alley-streets in Venice, but certainly doable with the help of my printed google map. I stayed with a friend in a room in the annex, which we found to be quite nice - we were the only ones staying there so it was quiet and we had the bathroom all to ourselves. The room was a bit more spacious than the other accomodations we have tried to Italy. There was an air conditioner as well, which was great for the humid summers of Venice! The bathroom was modern and clean as well, with a hairdryer. There was breakfast every morning in the main part of the hotel, included in the rate only you book with the hotel itself (as opposed to venere.com or a similar site, or so I hear). It was buffet-style with simple pastries, juice, and coffee, but very filling. The hotel is also very close to a vaporetto stop and a 15 min walk from the San Marco plaza. Around the hotel were a drug store, a few restaurants that served very tasty Italian fare, and small shops and boutiques. The hotel staff were ok - the owner has a little bit of an awkward personality but was nice enough to find my friend a room for a few extra nights on short notice (she was to stay longer than I was). The female receptionist seemed stressed and was kind of rude. But is a minor point in my opinion. All in all, it had everything we needed as budget travelers and gave us an affordable, convenient, quiet, clean, and safe place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet corner of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Annzie
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this Hotel by a friend and were very happy with our stay here. We did not find it difficult to locate and once there were very happy to be away from the crowds. It was very quiet but close enough to everything we needed. Venice is such an amazing place and we had a wonderful time. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The room was like staying in an old palace and we find to to be clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Bernardi Semenzato!”
Reviews.Author: StephnJay
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel on a two week honeymoon all throughout Italy, and we thought it was wonderful! We arrived via the airport, caught the #5 bus to the train station, then the vaporetto to the Ca d'oro stop. If you follow the directions given by the hotel, it is very easy to find - I was suprised, after so many reviews to the contrary. We also arrived at 9pm and had no issues. We were given room 303 in the Annex (per our request) and it was spotless, and very large. It easily exceeded our expectations for the price. I loved the location - not in the middle of the 'tourist' area, and we easily could walk to several vaporreti stops, and also a pleasant walk thru the beautiful streets to the Rialto Bridge. We stayed two nights, and had a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Locked in!”
Reviews.Author: Codysang
Reviews.Content: Not a terrible place to stay. Evening staff member was extremely rude. Their "office hours" only go until midnight, so if you are out late, you must prearrange it by getting a front door key. BE AWARE - if you need to check out early, do it the day before and get a front door key. They lock the front door at night and you can't get out of the building. My fiance and I checked out on Sat afternoon because we had to leave early on Sunday (6am). When we tried to leave Sunday morning, all the doors were locked. Luckily we made enough noise where the evening staff member (I guess he was sleeping there) came out. After lecturing us that it was not within business hours and they were not "open" he finally opened the door and let us leave...... not a good lasting impression.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worked--tucked away in a nice little area”
Reviews.Author: pietogo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel July of 2007, and found it to be just fine. It was a little tricky finding it, but we somehow figured it out. It was tucked away but very close to the mail walkways and easy access to everything. Venice is a walking city, so anyplace you stay you'll just walk there anyway. There's a very yummy restaurant right next door to the hotel, with a very sweet Polish waitress that sat down with us at the table to chat. The only negatives that I can think of about this hotel is that the room's air conditioning only worked "ok" and the shower was a bit funky (the shower curtain only goes down to about knee level and with water ended up allll over the floor in the bathroom). The little morning breakfast that was included in the price was more than sufficient and really helped out with our budget. We paid 122 Euros per night for our family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a miss!”
Reviews.Author: SLR75
Reviews.Content: Definitely give this hotel a miss if you can. We booked well in advance for 2 nights only and when we arrived we were told we would have to move rooms for each night. We were put in the "annex" for the first night. When we entered the room the smell of plug in deoderisers was overwhelming. After we switched them off and opened the window we realised why! The smell of sewerage was terrible! We were moved into the main hotel for the 2nd night which was better except when we tried to leave the next morning. We paid in advance as requested as we had to leave at 5am. When we tried to get out we found the front door of the hotel locked and no one around to open it. We banged and yelled for 5 minutes before someone emerged from a back room. Hate to think what would happen if there was a fire!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lapartier
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for the best value and good location. The room was clean and comfortable. We didn't stay at the main hotel, we were taken to another location that is also operated by the hotel which was about one block away. We were pleased with the safety of the area, the neighborhood was quiet, and it was close to everything. I wouldn't recommend buying the breakfast package since there are many other options in town that are better for eating.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless”
Reviews.Author: HollyQLD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bernardi for 4 nights. We had a double room with shared bathroom and found both our bedroom and bathroom spotless. The hotel is in a fantastic location, within walking distance of the train station and a short distance to the Rialto Bridge and many other sights in Venice. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and speak perfect English. The breakfast is a standard continental breakfast and great value when included in the cost of the room. I couldn't fault this budget beauty hotel. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: KIKODOSS
Reviews.Content: Simply put, Hotel Bernardi is a great little hotel. With its very convenient location next to the Ca D'Or, it offers and delivers everything a visitor to Venice could hope for. We found this little gem of a hotel purely by chance while surfing on the internet, and we were surely glad we did. The owners are very friendly, the rooms are well equipped, the location is wonderful and the price/value were unbeatable. You can surely spend a lot more when visiting Venice, but you won't necessarily have a better experience. When we return to Venice, we will definitely stay at Hotel Bernardi. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sungoddezz
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 2 nights at the Hotel Bernardi. We booked a double with a shared bathroom. I was a little apprehensive at first, not knowing what to expect especially sharing a bathroom with other people. However, our stay was more than adequate. We were sent directions on how to get to the hotel which were easy to follow and didn't have any trouble finding the hotel. The blonde girl at the reception was extremely friendly and loved Canadians because she loved Celine Dion so even though she isn't necessarily one of my favourites that day I became a Celine Dion fan. Our room was on the second floor of the main hotel and it was clean with air conditioning. There was a small sink in the room which I didn't expect to have so that was a nice treat. The bathroom with toilet/sink/shower was down the hall. The first night however the bathroom floor had about an inch of water on it and when I told the front desk in the morning they took care of it and said someone let the shower nozzle go over the top of the shower. We didn't have that problem the next night. The location of the hotel is very central to everything and within walking distance of everything. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the budget minded. Hotels in Venice are so over priced that finding one so conveniently situated at such a low price (58 euros a day) is a real find.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value In Venice........ No, Europe!!”
Reviews.Author: Greg92
Reviews.Content: I've traveled extensively and this modest hotel in Venice ranks the highest I've ever seen in value or price paid. Clean, good location, accommodating reception. I booked a single, shared bath room in July knowing my room didn't have air conditioning. However there was a good fan in the room and even with hot days, I was able to sleep comfortably with the fan on me. The room was small (about like the smallest bedroom in most U.S. suburban tract homes). It had a single bed, small wardrobe, small desk and a sink. It was extremely clean and functional. The shared bath was up one flight of steps but not a long walk. The bathroom was clean and the shower (always my judge of a good or bad hotel room) had lots of pressure and plenty of hot water. The continental breakfast was very typical European with packaged breads, yougart, juice and coffee. I ate and drank all I wanted and the servers were pleasant. I defy anyone to find a better accommodation for 35euros in the heart of any major city!

Reviews.Title: “Venice”
Reviews.Author: hhvvgg
Reviews.Content: Although we didn't encounter bed bugs I have to say that this hotel is less than clean. In one room there was rubbish in the bin from the previous occupant, another room had a used band aid stuck to the bedspread and in another room the cleaners missed a row of the previous occupants underwear drying on the radiator. Rooms for singles closely resemble prison cells, opening onto a well used walkway - there is no privacy. Staff are amongst the rudest we have encountered, with one night staff member who pretended not to understand english with us and another guest, but later was able to speak perfect english. The location is great, walking distance to all major sights, just be prepared for attitude on the desk.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE! BED BUG ALERT!”
Reviews.Author: momoco2525
Reviews.Content: It was absolutely horrible!!!! We stayed only 1 night and that was enough for us to be completely covered in bed bug bites! The hotel was hard to find, there are no elevators (and the stairwell is tiny), and our entire backs were covered with bed bug bites after just one night! DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place we stayed!”
Reviews.Author: tara_c48
Reviews.Content: We traveled throughout Italy and Greece, and this is by far the worst place we stayed. The front desk people were very rude. They gave us a tiny room on the ground floor with a window that looked out to a tiny, ugly walkway. The room smelled. There were no bathrooms on the 1st floor, so we had to go upstairs. This was very inconvenient during the night. There were only two showers, neither of which were on the first floor either. The bed was incredibly uncomfortable! The breakfast was pretty good, and they did offer free internet. I liked the location as well. But the rooms were terrible! Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AinsleyQ
Reviews.Content: One of the best places we stayed in during our entire Europe trip. Its rooms have a lovely, charming feel to it. The people at the reception desk were very helpful and offered great suggestions on how best to enjoy Venice. Great location and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, choice location”
Reviews.Author: dansyoung
Reviews.Content: It is hard to imagine a better value in Venice than the Bernardi. I've stayed twice, first last year in a single room by myself and most recently in late November in a double with my wife, and I was extremely pleased on both occasions. My friends -- one couple from Paris, the other from London -- also stayed in doubles and were extremely pleased. In particular, the doubles in the annex are spacious, clean and quiet. The location of the hotel, near the Ca d'Oro vaporetti stop, is ideal: You are close enough to the Rialto and San Marco but not directly in those tourist-crammed areas. I never had breakfast at the hotel and wouldn't bother, as I wouldn't want to miss an opportunity for a cappuccino and a pastry at the Brasilia, the Caffe Doge and other splendid cafes. The hotel is a scenic, 10-15 minute walk from the Fondamente Nuovo vaporetto stop, so you can take the vaporetto directly from the airport without having to take the bus, a taxi or change boats. Please note that during rainy seasons and on high-tide mornings you may need wellies or boots to exit the annex. My wife had wellies; I purchased fisherman's books at a nearby shop for 15 euros.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Terri_WeimarTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Venice with my sister and brother-in-law in September. We found this hotel using trip advisor and Frommers. We were given rooms in the Annex which were quite lovely. The rooms and the bathrooms were very clean. The breakfast was the weakest amenity-and I have to say, (like the other reviews I read) the lady who was the waitress?? was pretty surly. My brother-in-law asked for a second cup of coffee and was told he had to pay for it!! That was kind of astonishing! They should discontinue the breakfast and charge less! I had read an earlier review by someone who said the staff wasn't that friendly but he wasn't staying with the staff! I have to agree with that assessment. Actually, the lady who helped serve the breakfast was the only cranky one we saw. The location of the hotel is not too bad-it isn't close to San Marco square but it was fun walking there (and losing our way). We quickly found that walking was preferable to the crowded vaporettos, unless we were in a hurry. All in all, a fairly pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “decent value with problems”
Reviews.Author: travelitaly7
Reviews.Content: Bring your mosquito repellent if you are going when these critters are still alive. We were bitten nightly by the invasion of these mosquitoes. The breakfast is on the low end both for the type and freshness of food and presentation. I wanted another espresso and they told me they would bill me 2 euro for this! Apparently one shot of espresso is all one can expect. The coffee was not even good. The breakfast area is too small and often overcrowded. The in room shower was a joke. No presssure and a small space that you couldn't even turn around in. The patrons with early departure would drag there suitcases down the steps at 4:00 to 5:00 am each day. The walls are thin and the noise would wake up the hotel. The staff was preoccupied and not very friendly. I had reserved a room with a shower almost 8 months before my visit. Only to find out the day before we left that they had made an error and I would have to move around the hotel during my stay. However, this was corrected by the time we arrived and we didn't have to move our rooms. Information given out by the front desk was often incorrect. There is a midnight curfew and the door is locked. This doesn't bother me but the night attendant would not sit at the desk and patrons would have to ring the bell to be admitted. This would go from about 12:01 am to 3:00 am. Finally we had bites of unkown origin around our face after a few days, these bites were different from the mosquito bites.This concludes the problem portion. The hotel and rooms were clean. The beds were small but comfortable. The location of the hotel was very central and we were able to walk in any direction with the aid of the tragetto crossing near Ca'D'Oro. The price of the room was very good for Venice. I would probably spend a night or two in this hotel but I would not stay for an extended period. Too many negatives

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Watie04
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 travelling Europe June/July 07 spent 3 nights at the Hotel Bernardi. Booking was done via email and all the communication was prompt and efficient. Room of average standard - rather tired and old - but good to be able to accommodation 4 in one room. Good value for money for Venice standards. Bathroom clean but very small. Breakfast good. Some staff friendly and helpful but others rather rude.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bernardi was a nice stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ria6677
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Bernardi during the hot summer month of August. Thankfully, they had air conditioning, which kept the room cool. We were told we would have a small double bed to share, but were pleasantly surprised to have an extra twin bed in the room. The room was fairly large for this class of hotel/pensione. It had an armoire and a sink... would have liked a towel rack, but there wasn't one. We had a shared bathroom. The bathrooms were clean and nice. Our shuttered windows faced one of Venice's alleyways and the view was quaint. Be sure to mention Frommer's when booking, and you'll receive a discount. I read about previous posts claiming rate disputes, so I had mine on hand, prepared for a problem. However, there was no problem. They gave us the rate quoted. However, our rate did not include breakfast. We had to pay extra. The breakfast was prepackaged food. I would have preferred to spend the same amount in a cafe. The location is good. We walked there from the train station; you can also walk to Rialto and San Marcos. Also, there is an internet cafe directly across the street. Compared with other hotels that cost about the same as Hotel Bernardi, I thought it was nice; it had a true reception area and lounge, breakfast area, internet, TV in the room, clean shared bathrooms and showers, large-ish rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: ruthmarti
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two teenagers) stayed here in July. We couldn't have been happier. We had our own bathroom and were able to stay all four in one room. It wasn't huge, but many hotels don't have rooms that sleep 4. The owners were extremely friendly (not even remotely grumpy), the breakfast was great, we were able to use the internet for 15 minutes for free. They kept our bags for us when we had a night train. It was an easy walk to all the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “BIG Dud!”
Reviews.Author: chaphill
Reviews.Content: Oh my, where to begin....Contacted and received confirming email from the hotel for to rooms. When arrived, they indicated that only one room was available and that we had cancelled the 2nd(which was not the case). Then the fun began. The rooms are nothing as advertised and are one class above hostel quality. Don't understand how any reviewers could give this any rating above below average.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little place at a good price”
Reviews.Author: TexasLove2trvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of the price and hotel's ability to accomodate family of four. We stayed on the third floor and had a rather large room by european standards with a sink in the room. We booked a shared bathroom that was in the corridor, but never heard anyone else use it the whole time there, we did only stay 2 days however. I believe other rms on the floor have their own restroom so that aspect worked out okay. The shower room was pretty disappointing however as it is the size of a small closet, floods, and reminded me of camp days in my youth. The rooms decor was "frugal" Venetian in style, but really did remind us where we were. We did not have much of a view but the green shuttered windows did open into the small street and church bells rang every hour and that was lovely. I enjoyed hearing Venetians and Italians getting ready for business early in the day as they walked through the narrow street. The only real contact we had with hotel employees was the man at the front desk....believe he was the manager. He was cool bordering on rude, but did hold our luggage as we arrived on an early morning train from Paris as our room was not ready. I don't think that he even looked at us or thanked us when we checked out. I suppose one can do that when you're one of the few affordable hotels in such an expensive city. I would consider staying at this hotel once more should we visit Venice with our family again, though I would prefer to stay in the annex (which an employee e-mailed my request saying that they are highly sought after, and difficult to obtain). I would however book a room with a bath.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Grumpy Staff”
Reviews.Author: MisterAnon
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Bernardi for two nights in one of the rooms on the top floor. Here are our brief thoughts: PROS The room itself was great -- top floor, relatively spacious and clean, private bathroom, air conditioning. Making the reservations with Leonardo and Santina was easy using e-mail. The location is good, close to the Rialto Bridge and other Venice sights. The night manager was very friendly and helpful. Small discount if you pay cash when checking out. CONS I had confirmed a room with two single beds and was surprised that our room actually had one double bed (standard mattress) and one small single fold-out cot. I drew the short straw and slept on the cot both nights -- it was NOT pleasant -- I would say two of the worst nights I have had in recent memory. The front desk staff (Leonardo and I would assume Santina) were NOT at all welcoming and not that friendly. They never gave us the impression that they wanted us there as guests. We overheard on both days different guests having "concerns" with the management over their nightly rate (this wasn't a problem for us as I had a copy of my e-mails confirming our rate). The staff who served us breakfast both days (same people) were not pleasant at all. No smiles, no nothing. Not exactly the most pleasant way to start the day. WOULD WE STAY THERE AGAIN? Marginally yes -- the price and location are good and we don't have to vacation with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gregelvis
Reviews.Content: I took a school Art trip to this hotel in February of 2007. The hotel was great value, clean and very well located. When Ryanair cancelled our flight at the last minute and left me stranded in Venice with 28 school children the hotel moved heaven and earth to find places for all of us (and let us pay later as we had no money left). Lovely people. I will use this hotel every time I take a group to Venice. Greg Morgan, Saint George's School Rome

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: GrannyAnge
Reviews.Content: This is a truly wonderful little hotel and the location was perfect for our group of 6 friends. We stayed here twice - 4 nights at the beginning and the last night of our holiday. the 4 nights we stayed in the hotel and the last night we stayed in the annexe - when we return we will ask for rooms in the annexe as they were larger and looked out onto a canal but for the price - â‚¬62 for a double with shared bath - i would stay in any of the rooms available. It took us 5 mins to walk to the Rialto and about 10/15 to St Marks Sq - we took the traghetto over to the Fish market 50cents 2 mins for our breakfast and the vaporetto stop is 5 mins away - the Strada Nuevo is fantastic for people watching and the bars and cafes fantastic and good value for money - i cannot recommend this hotel highly enough for the location and value. All the staff that we met were helpful and very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Hotel Bernardi”
Reviews.Author: aixpat
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with what we got for the low price: modest but clean and comfortable rooms, a decent breakfast, and helpful staff. The location is fine. I think Hotel Bernardi is a great option for budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful not to get overcharged”
Reviews.Author: Pinky_and_Brain
Reviews.Content: Before making any other considerations or comparisons it's necessary to take into account that Venice is one of THE most expensive places to visit for tourists in all of Europe. The guy at reception told us in a heavy Italian accent "ehhhhh.... yes !.... U aff foond aeh juell!" ("You have found a jewel.")....as usual the Italians are masters in excelling in the art of exaggeration ! A jewel it is definitely not...but as far as the extortionate rates of Venice hotels go, this place is pretty reasonable priced at 60-160 euro per night considering its central location INSIDE the main part of Venice. However I would offer some points of advice to whoever wants to stay at this place (and in general for other smaller privately run hotels in Italy): 1.) Get confirmation of the rate you are quoted in writing (either on arrival or by email or fax beforehand AND the name of the person who has quoted it to you. I was quoted one rate on the phone and then another on arrival. I argued and mentioned the name of the person who gave the original quote and managed to pay only that. Other people I saw getting billed during my stay there paid much higher prices. 2.) Make sure your room has a bathroom with a sink, toilet, AND shower and that you do not have to use a shared one. 3.) Virtually every extra facility you might expect to be included in the rate had an extra cost. Air conditioning - Extra fee; en-suite bathroom -extra fee; remote control to watch TV - extra fee; etc, etc. Read the fee's lists in your room carefully ! 4.) Ask when and if they close the hotel at night so you are not locked out ! 5.) Make sure you know when check out time is (it can be as early as 10.00 in the morning sometimes!) 6.) Italians rarely have more than a roll or croissant and a small espresso for breakfast - don't expect to get much unless they specify more. 7.) Make sure you get a receipt. (As with everything you may pay for in Italy.) 8.) Get your passport or ID back as soon as they're done registering your details. If they insist itâ€™s a form of deposit leave a credit card NUMBER instead. ------------------------------ The room we had was an en-suite (with shower) which was spacious and clean and we did not have any complaints while we were there. Venice really is beautiful and the wonderful thing is that there are no cars creating a tranquillity you won't find anywhere else in Italian cities elsewhere. However some points to keep in mind when visiting: a) It's VERY maze-like and no matter how reliable your memory or orientation is, you WILL get lost at some point. Bring a good map. (On the other hand, because it's an island, you'll never be able to wander too far off. b) When going and coming from the airport take the local orange-red public bus (not the boats) which stops on the only dry part of Venice that has cars. BIG savings! c) Buy drinks from local supermarkets in the side alleyways (avoid anything on the main squares and roads) unless you want to pay 10 euro for a can of coke ! d) Check the small writing on the bottom or the back of your restaurant menu. Chances are you will be billed a 3 to 10 euro cover charge PER PERSON, AND a 5 to 20% service charge on top of your bill! Avoid those restaurants which do this to an unreasonable extent! Venice is notorious for this ! e) If you feel you've been overcharged anywhere, get a receipt with all charges detailed (by law they have to give you a receipt for income tax purposes), and tell them you will go to the "Guardia di finanza" (Italian finance police) to review the charges. Perhaps that will help "solve" the disagreement! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good price does not equal good experience”
Reviews.Author: vrolyat
Reviews.Content: The personnel is terrible. Rude and unhelpful. they moved our luggage from our room to pretty much a closet without our permission. Threw our stuff on the beds and on the floor. They have a curfew at 1 a.m. and you are locked out if you don't get in on time. The breakfast is not complementary. I have stayed in hostels and hotels all over Europe and this is the worst staff I have ever dealt with. It is REASONABLY priced and a decent location. There is only one bathroom per floor so if you are on the ground floor you have to go upstairs to share the bathroom with the entire first floor. as long as your main concern is price and you don't care about service, cleanliness or convenience you are good to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: seattleμnich
Reviews.Content: We arrived to venice via car, and had the very helpful reservation person at the carpark book us at the Hotel Bernardi per our guide books review of it. We were VERY happy with the hotel!! First disclaimer though, you get what you pay for. It's one of the best values in venice- meaning that it's not a 4 star hotel with world class service. Per other reviews, yes- you could stay at another pricier hotel, and get breakfast staff that have a smile on their face. Frankly, skip breakfast for a cappucino and pastry on your way out to the sites. With that in mind, this hotel is a great choice for your venice stay! Hotel details: Breakfast is a typical european spread with individual bagged croissants, coffee, and some jam. Nothing great. The wife/owner was very nice, while I agree the breakfast staff and husband/owner doesnt give much notice to the guests. But, again who cares! Just remember to ask for your passport back upon check-out, as they might not remember for you. We stayed in their 'annex' which was just a couple alleys away. It was supposedly cheaper (90euros) and we never went back to the main hotel except on check-out day. Our room was really, really big, clean, had a bathroom, and again the owner woman who checked us in was very friendly. I've highly recommended this hotel to friends, as it was such a prime location and great value in venice. The hotel is just off a cute main shopping street, and in walking distance to everything. It's also close to a major canal stop (good when you're lugging luggage around), and there's a gondola crossing you can take near the hotel for only a few euros (take your picture with them instead of paying 70euros for a short, non-eventful gondola ride). Other TIPS: we met people staying at a nicer hotel right on the grand canal, and they were really bitter by the end of their 4 night stay. They said the grand canal is busy all night long and kept them up. As for other noise, expect some construction nearby at almost any hotel, as the city is constantly under construction. But they only work during the day, while you are out, so doesnt normally matter- unless you are a late sleeper. If you continue to take the public water bus from the hotel all the way to the dom, you will get a great (and cheap) view of venice. Dont hire a water taxi, they show you the same thing for more money. Also, venice is a city of alleys. When we first arrived, I thought it was dirty and scarey. By the end, you are used to it and it's fun to think you're heading to a dead end when all of a sudden, a small passage on your left appears. I also think you can do most of venice and get your fill in 1-2 days. We also recommend trying: lots of gelato, a spritz aperol (alcohol drink) in summer, and visiting verona (about 1.5 hours from venice). Have fun in italy!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: kat&jimbo
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value hotel in an excellent location. The staff were helpful - we sent them a list of restaurants before we arrived and they made reservations for us. The only downside we found was that the walls seemed a bit thin, as we could hear people talking in the neighbouring rooms. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: honoluluhonu
Reviews.Content: Our first night was somewhat less than stellar because the lady occupying our room was ill, so they put us up in the owner's apartment nearby. No one else was there, we had access to a bedroom and the bathroom, and it was fine, with the interesting addition of auntie across the hall waking us up in the morning with a long stream of Italian! We were then moved to a nice room in the Annex. We enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again if we get back to Venice. The Ca' d'Oro vaporetto stop is only a few blocks away, so getting around Venice is easy from here.

Reviews.Title: “Its what you expect.”
Reviews.Author: epapera
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bernardi was a good fit for us in Europe. My husband insisted on having a personal bathroom and it fit the bill. I agree with most of the people that the woman who worked the front desk was not overly friendly but the gentlemen who worked both the night and morning shift were very pleasant, nice and gave great food reccomendations (incidentally one of the restaurants was recommended in the 2006 Frommer's Italy book as well Ai Tre Spiedi (sp?) Anyway, the room was small and a touch noisy (we had windows facing the alley) but the location for Venice was superb! Its off the Ca'D'Oro Vaparetto stop and we just felt like our hotel was perfect for our needs. We stayed at a chain in Rome and a slightly upscale place in Florence but I felt that this place really stretched your money's worth. And as for the breakfast, I thought it was just fine. If people are really having issue with what is served at the Bernardi, there are TWO bakeries around the corner on the Strada Nuova that sell pastries starting at 1 Euro. Those were delicious if you cannot stomach the quick breakfast the Bernardi served. By the way, we were room 21 (second floor). Remember if you want the view of the Grand Canal and what not, this is NOT the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Australian1
Reviews.Content: It seems that some people have a terrible time at this hotel. They tried to give us a tiny, smelly room on the ground floor for the first night of our three night stay, telling some story about a group of elderly people (who never materialised). After we protested, the haughty receptionist admitted there was a room available. It turned out to be very nice and we took it, but the staff continued to be rude and unhelpful, with the exception of the man on night duty one evening who was nice. The man I think was the manager, ignored us completely every time we greeted him, and when we checked out merely handed us the receipt without a word or even a glance. The staff working in the breakfast room were extremely grumpy and slammed the plates around while muttering to themselves. The bread roles were so stale one morning they were inedible. In short, stay at the Bernardi Semenzato if you want to risk sleeping in a small dark room, and if you enjoy being paying to be insulted. If you have a thick skin though, by all means take advantage of their cheap rates and just ignore the nasty behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain”
Reviews.Author: lambs1
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay here and although our room was small it was very clean and quite adequate. Tiny bathroom but we expected that so it was no problem. The only complaint we had was the one woman at the desk - she was so unfriendly - and actually sneered when we asked a question about transportation to the airport. This attitude was on both days that we stayed there. It was just in such sharp contrast to the attention we received in the other B&B's we stayed at in italy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - Perfect For Us!”
Reviews.Author: alicatlemons
Reviews.Content: We were pleasently surprised at the cleanliness and quaint location of the Hotel Bernardi. When we checked in we met Santina - who is an absolute doll and one of the few truly friendly people we met on our 2 week stay in Italy. She was very sweet and gave us recommendations on restaurants and such. We had 2 rooms in the annex which was a short walk from the main hotel. We quite liked the area since it was in a more locals area but also just a short walk to the major attractions esp. the Rialto Bridge. The rooms were immaculate. We were a bit disappointed with the breakfast but I wouldn't let that be a factor since you will be getting more than you pay for with the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: madoden1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Venere.com (which is a great service) and I have to admit that I was hesitant... After three years living in Milan and a decade of traveling back to Italy, it is just a given that hotels in Venice are expensive and less than expected. My worst hotel experiences have been in Venice, so I don't know what possesed me to book such an inexpensive hotel. We were a group of 5 - two families, and they gave us two rooms with a shared bath. I believe the rooms were #7 and #8 in the annex - and the bath was in a hall that adjoined our rooms and it had a lockable door at the end so we had our own little "wing". Both rooms were nice and had great air conditioning (a miracle!) but the end room (8) also had windows opening onto a nice canal. The rooms were very quiet and clean and had some nice antique furniture. It was a short walk to San Marco - maybe 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: greencap
Reviews.Content: It's true this is a budget hotel in a convenient location but if you're a light sleeper or staying for more than one night, stay somewhere else! For two nights we were there in the main building, many people came in after midnight and made a racket. Talking very loud, moving arounding, opening and closing doors, pulling baggages, taking showers, flushing toilets, .........until 2am. Complaint about it in the morning and was assured that the "kids" would be told not to use the common shower after midnight. Guess what? Same again at night. Find out the next day by chance that there's a budget flight arriving very late many time a week. So being a budget hotel, they will receive a few of these late arrivals. If you're arriving late into Venice, go ahead for this hotel, it's If you need good night sleep, avoid it! Also the "private bath" we had was a very very small bathroom with a small corner measured 2.5 feet sq. with a plastic curtain. It sticks to you when you turn the water on!

Reviews.Title: “Good - A Little Loud”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annex of this hotel in room 4. The window opens up to a street which can get loud because of the design of the street below. The voices really carry a long way and can cause for a bad nights sleep if you are sensative to noise. I was always so tired that a train would not have awaken me. You might ask for a room that is in the interior if you are sensative to sounds. We also had a bit of a smell from the canals but again I am a science teacher that has become immune to gross smells. My husband noticed it but said that it was only strong at times. Again if you are sensative to smells, well just dont go to Venice because the canals are a bit stinky at times. The bed is fine, the room is spacey and the bathroom/ shower is a good size for Europe. The vaporretto stops very close to the hotel and it is only a 4-5 minute walk from the stop. I would not recommend the restaurant directly across the hotel lobby. It's not bad for a drink but stay away for dinner. There is also an "internet point" very close to the hotel lobby to access your e-mail. The food is very expensive in venice and supermarkets are not very common. When you get off of the vaporretto (5 euro per ride good for 60 minutes or you can get a travel card)on Ca'de Oro instead of going right to the hotel go left and over a bridge. On the left hand side you will find a grocery store startswith a "B" for water and snacks. As for the attractions you can book online a reservation for St. Mark's basilica instead of standing in that long line. Also if you can book the secret itenerary tour for the Dukes palace. Call before 2pm a few days before you plan to visit.It is a very good tour.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: noodlesPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I will say that the hotel is in a good location..but i was still disappointed. we stayed at the annex. it was an umarked building away from the hotel so when we tried to find our way back later that night we had trouble locating it. hotel room was not very impressive for the price...we were expecting more (see pics). but the worst part was the smell coming from the bathroom....it smelled like sewer and we don't know why. we would close the lid to the toilet, cover the drain on the floor with the trash can...but nothing would fix the odor. so, we'd have to open the window, which of of course leads to bugs. this resulted in us waking up in the middle of the night to find and kill the bugs that were buzzing in our ears all night....

Reviews.Title: “Great, not so "touristy" location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Italy042006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Bernardi for a couple of nights in mid April and would recommend this hotel to anyone. I was travelling with 3 other people and we got a room with a bathroom which was really nice. The rooms are very clean and have big windows you can open up for some nice fresh Venetian air. This hotel in located a little ways out of the centre of Venice but in my opinion is a much better location than getting caught up in all the tourist rip offs closer to San Marco. The closest Vaporetta stop is Ca D'or which is about a 2 minute walk and within 5-15 minutes you can be anywhere you want in Venice. It seems to also be in a more residential neighbourhood which is great as you can hang out in the campo with the locals!! Also, try out the Coop grocery store for some cheap wine and grab some awesome cheese and bread for lunch. If you are looking for an excellent and affordable restaurant, seek out the Taverna San Trovaso which is near the Accademia Vaporetta stop. The address is Fondamenta Priuli, Dorsoduro 1016 . A huge plate of spaghetti Scoglio (shell fish) is 11 Euro but it is loaded with Mussels, prawns, clams etc. etc. If you get a second course you could split it with another person. Delicious. (See Picture) The Hotel Bernardi is a great value for Venice. I would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: sarabc99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a short walk from the vaporetto stops. It is located in a very quiet and safe area with lots of restaraunts and shops close by. The people at the hotel were very friendly and really went out of their way to help me. The rooms were spotless. My only complaint was that there wasn't a bathroom on my floor (ground level), but it wasn't a big deal to climb a few stairs. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great room at a great price”
Reviews.Author: kfr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the rooms in the hotel annex (E120/night) for four nights; I chose this hotel in part because they had rooms that could hold four people (our two kids were with us). The room we had (#5 on the second floor - the floor above the ground floor) was large, furnished nicely, very clean, and had a seemingly recently renovated bathroom (with a great towel warmer). The morning continental breakfast (included) was more than adequate and consisted of coffee, tea, or hot chocolate, fresh rolls, cake/pastry, orange juice, and yogurt on some mornings. The location seemed as convenient as any, it was certainly as easy to walk to San Marco as it was to take a vaporetto there. I recommend the bar/restaurant directly across the narrow street from the hotel office. The have a wide assortment of cichetti (mostly fish and shellfish appetizers/tapas) that, along with their house white wine make for a good, cheap evening meal. If you don't like fish, then you should probably admit that you are an incomplete person, unworthy of the best Italian food, stay at home and eat at the Olive Garden. My kids hate fish, but they managed to always find something to eat (they are unworthy too, but I take them along anyway!). Regarding the hotel, the proprietors responded quickly to my e-mail inquiry, they take credit cards (I guess not that unusual these days!), and the rooms were always made up every day while we were out seeing the sights. If you are arriving on the Aliluguna boat from the airport, get off at Fondamento (sp?) Nuove, head south on a five to ten minute walk to San Apostoli church and you'll be within a hundred meters of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: fletcher2005
Reviews.Content: Definately in a great location near the water taxi. Very small cramped room with a sink. Had long lines in the morning for the toilet/shower. We were on a budget, but wish we would have spent more and got a room with the toilet and shower.

Reviews.Title: “A second fine stay at this typically Venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudeClichy
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Bernardi-Semenzato in two years. Venice was the third stop on our 2005 trip to Europe between September and October. Other stays included the Residence La Tavolozza in Positano, the Hotel Alimandi in Rome, and the Mercure Tour Eiffel Suffern in Paris. Also see my reviews of these hotels. We had stayed at the Bernardi for three nights in September 2004, and came back this year (2005) for six nights. There are important things to remember about this hotel. It is family-run (owned by Maria Teresa and Leonardo Pepoli). It is not a luxury hotel - it is a simple place. It is not in a prime tourist area, and frankly, I consider that a very good thing indeed. It does not have elevators. It's in an alley. If you want luxury, by all means stay near St. Mark's Square, but be prepared to be surrounded mostly by other tourists and be prepared to pay a fortune for food. One of the joys of travel is to experience the locals, their customs, and to enjoy simply prepared local food. I have read mixed reviews about this hotel on this site. I wonder about them because the sense I get is that people are bringing their own expectations to staying here. If you want to be pampered and coddled, or want room service, or want a big breakfast - don't stay here. Those things are not germane to the Bernardi. Starting off, the Bernardi is in the Cannaregio neighborhood of Venice, not near St. Mark's Square. The hotel is about an 8-minute walk from the main post office and the nearby Rialto Bridge and incredible Rialto Market. The hotel is a minute away from a typical small Venetian piazza, Ss. Apostoli Square, from which The Strada Nuovo begins. The square has amenities like an outdoor cafe, a newstand, some restaurants, food shops, a beautiful church (Santi Apostoli), and plenty of people hurrying to and fro. The Strada is a fantastic neighborhood street filled with bakeries, gelateria, banks, food shops, shops selling glass or clothes or soaps, even hardware and stationery. There is even a medium-size supermarket. The Strada runs for about 20 minutes and will take you - as it bends and crosses footbridges and changes its name - to the Santa Lucia Train Station, Venice's main station. On the north side of Cannaregio - a six minute walk from the hotel - is the Fondamente Nova vaporetto stop (the boat bus) from where you can catch the vaportetto to the islands of Murano and Burano, or take a ride around the north side of the Venetian Lagoon to the Lido. We had purchased 3-days boat/bus passes for 22-Euros at the vaporetto kiosks outside the train station. The hotel is minutes away from the Ca' D'Oro Vaporetto stop, which is down a narrow alley off The Strada. This is one of the main stops on the Grand Canal. Again, it is highly recommended that you buy a pass because the boat/buses can cost 3-6 Euros per ride depending on where you are catching them. The Grand Canal Vaporetto (boat/bus #1) is now 6 Euros. A pass makes sense. And the #1 is the main boat from the train station to the hotel. The Ca' D'Oro stop is at a beautiful restored palazzo - the classic, famed Ca' D'Oro building. Get off the boat and walk up the very narrow alley. You'll get to The Strada. Turn right. Walk a few minutes to Ss. Apostoli Square. You'll know when you're there. Turn left, walk past the cafe and a couple of storefronts and you'll see Calle de l'Oca. This is a very narrow lane (alley). It's important to note and remember that Venice is made up of thousands of very narrow alleys. It is no shame to get lost in Venice. Even the Venetians get lost. A visitor is expected to get lost. It's a time-honored tradition. Frankly, the rule is that if you haven't gotten lost, you haven't really walked around Venice. When you look down Calle de l'Oca, you'll see a small white sign with black lettering that reads Hotel Bernardi. It's across from a restaurant and next to a restaurant. That's your home in Venice. Your welcome will be pleasant. If you are staying in the main hotel building, you have already chosen not to have a bathroom in your room. If you accepted a room on the very first floor (the least expensive rooms - and this is not an expensive hotel), you will be off the lobby near the tiny breakfast kitchen and you will have to walk across the hall to get to your shower and toilet. The upper floor rooms have shower rooms and separate toilet facilities in the hallway that you will be sharing with other guests. Ask questions before you book. I don't understand people who don't ask questions. The Bernardi also has rooms and suites down some alleys near a small canal. This is the Bernardi Annex building. The rooms will have both a private bath (with a shower) and toilet in-room. The second floor rooms are comfortable and not tiny. Some of them are very spacious and wildly decorated in the classic Venetian tradition. The owners have also remodeled a third-floor at their Annex and the rooms are superb-looking with beautiful bathroom facilities. We were in a second floor room - in fact, we were in the same room we had in 2004 - and that was alright with us. We did look at a remodeled third floor room, and it was wonderfully re-done. Here's one bit of advice regarding those new Annex rooms. The stairway up from floor 2 to floor 3 is very, very narrow. You have to walk - no elevator, and you will bring whatever luggage you have - large or small - up a step at a time. I should point out that the marble stairway from the Annex's street level entrance to the 2nd floor is wide, but again, if you have a heavy bag, it's a step at a time. By the way, around the corner from the Annex is a movie theater. And the men's clothing shop near the Annex has great affordable items. The man who owns it speaks solid English. Remember, the Bernardi has stairs to navigate in both buildings. If you want in-room bathing and toilet facilities, they are not available in every room - except in the Annex. You will pay more, although the Bernardi is not an expensive hotel. Very importantly, the Bernardi's housekeeping is top-notch. The rooms are cleaned daily. The towels are refreshed daily. The sheets are clean. The ladies who do the cleaning are wonderfully friendly and expert at maintaining cleanliness. Leonardo and Maria Teresa run a hotel that prides itself on room cleanliness, and it shows. If you're concerned about Venetian mosquitos, bring along some spray or repellent or buy some along The Strada. We only saw three mosquitos in our room over six days and swatted them with some newspaper. I have also read that people are concerned about the smell of the canals. Yes, on occasion the canals will have a slight odor, but not every day, and not all day. If the water in the lagoon is high - due to rain or tides - there might be sewer odors. Might. Trust me, the odor won't kill you, and it is not an all-pervasive smell. You're in Venice - it's an old, old, old place, and utterly fascinating and magical, even on cloudy days. It seems to be decaying, but it isn't. It's vibrant. People live and work there. There are no cars (except on the Lido island) and the joy of walking and the pleasure of the quiet are amazing experiences. I have read that people found some of the staff at the Bernardi rude or surly. Leonardo can be perfunctory - perhaps some will call it curt. He is really a very nice man and quite pleasant. Warm up to him. Try some Italian. He does speak very good English. His wife, Maria Teresa teaches English, and she's a beautiful and charming woman. If you have a problem or a question, don't be afraid to bring it up. Leonardo is not going to bite off your head. The breakfast at the Bernardi is simple. Prepare yourself for it. Coffee (or tea), juice, yogurt, and pound cake or pastry. That's it. A classic European continental breakfast. Nothing more. Yes, one of the girls serving it needs to smile a bit more. Why not give her a smile? Give her a small tip - perhaps a Euro. We did, each day. Take charge during your trip. Don't hesitate to act, rather than only react. Dining in Venice is pleasurable, but watch out for the Ristoranti Al Vagon, which is near the Bernardi, and has outdoor tables near a small canal. The restaurant is in the Al Vagon hotel. By the way, the Al Vagon Hotel does not have good ratings on Tripadvisor. We are not very demanding people, but this is a restaurant where the staff is definitely not pleasant and the food only passably good. The woman who seemed to be in charge pretended she did not speak English, but when push came to shove, she spoke it. I find very few Venetians who play this game. In fact, I find very few Italians who play this game. When I ordered a roast veal entree, the woman asked me if I wanted a salad or vegetables or potato to go with it. She clearly indicated that it came with the entree. By the way, this was the worst roast veal I've ever eaten. The slices were 1/16 of an inch thick and seemed to be veal roll, not pure meat. Imagine my surprise when the check came and I was charged a steep extra fee for the salad that I truly expected to come with the meal. The restaurant also has an absurd 3 Euro per person cover charge. This is often seen on the menu as a "coperto." And it's sometimes a bread charge and is usually one Euro or 1.50. Never have I seen it 3 per person. A table of four Brits near us questioned 12-Euros on their menu for seemingly nothing - a few breadsticks is what they give you for your 3 euros per person. The Brits missed the tiny type indicating the 3-euro charge per person. Avoid the Al Vagon restaurant. A restaurant to definitely seek out is Trattoria Ca' D'Oro Alla Vedova. The restaurant is in a nameless alley entrance off the Strada Nuovo. It's card reads Cannaregio 3212, Fermata Ca' D'Oro. That means it's near the vaporetto stop at Ca' D'Oro, which, of course, is the Bernardi's stop. Here's how to find it. Leave the hotel. Walk up The Strada to the Ca' D'Oro Vaporetto Stop alley entrance. Stop walking. Look to your right and you'll see walk space that goes back about 50 feet. There's a restaurant at the end. That's The Trattoria Ca' D'Oro Alla Vedova. The food is world class, with a mushroom lasagna - if available - that will knock your socks off. The eggplant lasagana is also spectacular. Seafood? Of course, and it's superb. The restaurant is not big on desserts, however. We ate there twice and one time I had a succulent liver and onion dish that changed forever the way I will look at liver and onions. I've never experienced anything like it.
